loans.name: Aulerie

texts.en: Aulerie is 20 years old. She is married and has one child, two years old.  She has been selling bread and andazi for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more flour to make more andazi bread and chapati to sell in her boutique. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more flour and food flasks for sale

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives in Meghri town with her husband, daughter and son. Her son serves in the army.

Svetlana keeps a cow. She started agribusiness a few months ago and has worked hard to develop it. Realizing how the income from agriculture is important for Svetlana, she has decided to enlarge her farm. Therefore, Svetlana has applied for this loan to purchase 2 cows and forage for feeding the livestock. With the loan's help, Svetlana will be able to start the production of cheese and will gather more income from its sales.

As this is Svetlana's first loan it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cows and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman was born in 1978. She is married and lives with her husband and her four sons and daughters in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. She has been trying her best to assist her husband in improving their living conditions by running her project of selling blankets from her house for the last year. Now she needs to expand the business by buying a larger quantity of blankets to raise her profits, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for her business

loans.name: Mahdeya

texts.en: Mahdeya was born in 1974. She is married and lives with her husband in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. She has been trying her best to assist her husband in improving their living conditions by running her project of selling home products and clothes from her house for the past year. Now she needs to expand the business by buying a larger quantity of home products and adding kitchen tools to attract more customers and to raise her profits, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add kitchenware to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ladies' handbags and students' bookbags for her business.

loans.name: Obed's Group

texts.en:
Obed’s group has 8 group leader farmers and is located in Matete District.  The group leaders in this group represent a total of 80 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  As the Kiva group representative, Obed is pictured on the right of the group with his hand raised.
							
Obed is 40 years old and has been a farmer for 12 years.  Obed works as a farmer to provide for his 5 children.  The community and other farmers know Obed as friendly and hardworking.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community in groups such as the men's group.  Obed described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

Obed first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Obed joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader.  Obed plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to save for the future.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Obed’s own life was improved because he has more farm training, and was able to feed the family.  							

Obed and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Khasoko's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 5 group leader farmers in Matete District with Khasoko selected as the Kiva representative.  Khasoko has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 52 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Khasoko is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with 9 children.  Khasoko is 49 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 38 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Khasoko is very active in his community and is involved in the prayer group and burial committee.  He described his harvest last year as not with One Acre Fund.  He hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer he is able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program!							
							
The 2013 Long Rains season will be Khasoko’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He joined this year in order to get new farming methods and earn enough to feed his family.  As an active member in his community, Khasoko also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member.  Khasoko plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school.  He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund.							
						
Khasoko and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana de 37 años de edad, solamente estudió hasta segundo grado, ella está divorciada, tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella y que actualmente están estudiando. 

Ella tiene más de un año de dedicarse a la venta de ropa en el cantón donde vive y en los caseríos aledaños a la zona, este trabajo lo aprendió de su madre ya que también se dedica a lo mismo.
 
Ana debe caminar alrededor de 5 kilómetros, pues su trabajo es vender de casa en casa, y sus hijos la apoyan en el negocio cuando no van a la escuela. 

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar más mercadería, ya que tiene poco inventario, como lo es zapatos y ropa para niños, esto le permitirá crecer en su negocio, y así mismo obtener mayores ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Su sueño, es comprar una hectárea para construir su casa, pues donde vive actualmente no es de ella, espera heredarla a sus hijos, también sueña con seguir trabajando con sacrificio para que sus hijos sigan estudiando y que sean excelentes profesionales en un futuro.
texts.en:
Ana is 37 years old, and she only studied up to second grade. She is divorced and has three children who are at school and are dependent on her. 

For over a year she has worked selling clothes in the area where she lives and in the neighboring villages. She learned this trade from her mother who worked doing the same thing.
 
Ana has to walk about 5km, as her business is selling from door to door. Her children help her with the business when they are not in school.

Ana will use the loan to buy more merchandise, since she does not have a lot of stock, such as shoes and children's clothes. This will allow her to grow her business, and also increase her income to improve her quality of life.

Her dream is to buy a hectare to build a house, since she currently does not own her own home. She hopes to leave this house to her children. She also wants to continue working with sacrifice so that her children can continue their studies and become excellent professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as shoes and children's clothes.

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, vive en un cantón, está acompañada y su pareja es soldador de estructuras metálicas. Ella únicamente estudió hasta segundo grado. Tiene 3 hijas, una de ellas ya no vive en su casa,  su otra hija trabaja y su tercera hija actualmente estudia bachillerato y es la única que depende de ella.

Rosa, se dedica a la venta de hielo, charamuscas y chocobananos en su casa, esto le genera un ingreso económico extra para su familia, además se dedica al trabajo doméstico.
También tiene ingresos económicos que provienen de su esposo, ya que él tiene un trabajo fijo, pero en los días libres se dedica a la soldadura.

El dinero  del crédito, lo utilizara para mejorar su vivienda, ya que tiene la necesidad de instalar las puertas y ventanas de su casa, comprarán materiales como hierro, lámina, chapas, ángulos, electrodos, discos y pintura. 

La necesidad que cubrirá es la de tener una vivienda digna y segura para su familia.
Ella sueña con seguir manteniendo unida a su familia, que el negocio que tiene en su casa siga creciendo aún más, para dar un aporte económico extra a su familia, brindarle los estudios a su hija para que pueda salir a delante y logre ser una profesional que tan importante es hoy en día.
texts.en:
Rosa, 45, lives in a district with her partner, a welder, who works on metal structures. She only studied until the 2nd grade. She has three daughters. One no longer lives at home. One of her daughters works and her third daughter is studying in high school and is the only one supported by Rosa.

Rosa sells ice cream, popsicles, and chocolate-covered frozen bananas from her home to generate extra income for the family. She is also engaged in domestic work. She has another income coming in from her husband's steady job on the days he works in welding. 

She will use the loan money to improve her home. She needs to install doors and windows on her house and buy materials such as iron, sheeting, laminate, overlay, and paint which will cover her need to have decent, safe housing for her family.

She dreams that her family will stay together, that her business will continue to grow and that she can make an extra financial contribution to her family, and that she can help her daughter continue her studies so that she can get ahead and succeed at being a professional which is so important today.

loans.use: to install windows and doors on her home to provide more security.

loans.name: Acencion Felipe

texts.es:
Acencion de 53 años de edad, padre soltero con tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales están estudiando. Es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. El Sr. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente en su juventud no pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económicos, y su familia son personas de escasos recursos. Obligados por las necesidades y carencia económica trabajo desde muy temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, en la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles dentro de las medidas de su posibilidades a sus hijos y cumplir con sus sueños de todo padre como es ver formados a sus hijos en profesionales.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante Acencion tiene por actividad económica la venta de sorbetes y esquimos de diferentes sabores de forma ambulante . El dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir  de esquimo, para que en un futuro no muy  lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Acencion agradece a los inversionistas kiva la ayuda que le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Acencion, 53 years old, is a single dad with three underage children, who are students. He is a native of Leon, a place located in the western area of the country. He is known for being hardworking, responsible and with a desire to advance. Unfortunately he was not able to study when he was young due to the lack of financial resources. His family has scarce financial resources. Because of those needs and financial scarcity, he has been working since an early age to help with household expenses. Currently he struggles day by day to give his children the financial means and achieve every father's dream of educating them to become professionals. Thanks to his efforts and desire to advance, Acencion works selling sorbets and ice creams in different flavors as a street vendor. He works about ten hours every day offering his product. He will use this loan to invest it in working capital and stock up in ice cream, so that he can earn more income. Acencion is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the help they give to persons of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have a worthy job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock up his cart with ice cream of different flavors.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 38 years old and married. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with four children. She is a farmer and has been in the farming business for 10 years now. Besides farming, she also sells paraffin. She supports five people in her family. Her husband also provides additional income.

Sophia will be using the loan to buy paraffin for resale. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to buy a dairy goat and chickens for rearing. This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hope is to educate her children and build a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy paraffin for resale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 38 years old, married, and supports a family of six. His children are aged between nine and two. He has operated a slaughter house in Narok county, Kenya for the last eight years with a monthly income of 25,000 KES. 

Moses learned about Vision Fund from colleagues of his in the business. He has acquired his first loan of 20,000 KES which he will use to pay for the transportation of animals to the slaughter house. He will use the proceeds to pay fees for his children. His goal is to have a huge herd of animals so as to sustain the business.

loans.use: to pay for the transportation of animals to the slaughter house.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a twenty-seven year old hardworking gentleman, who supports a family of five. He has operated a motorcycle transport business for the last four years with an approximate monthly income of 24,000 KES. He learnt about Vision Fund from a staff member. 

John has been advanced a second loan of 20,000 KES, which he plans to use to put up a grocery stall for his wife. The proceeds from the business will be used to sustain the family's basic needs.

John's dream is to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to open a green grocery for his wife

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a farmer who is already highly skilled in animal breeding. She keeps two cows and seven calves. Rita lives with her three grown children in Litchk village. Agriculture helps the family have stable income during the year so it is very important for Rita to enlarge it. She has now applied for this loan to purchase two more cows and forage for feeding the livestock. Rita will be very grateful to lenders who will support her farming business and will help her to improve it.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Businge Tukole Group

texts.en: Gladys is a hardworking married woman with children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer who grows maize and beans for sale and home consumption. She also sells fresh foods for extra income. She ventured into this business in order to improve her agricultural enterprise with a vision of being able to educate her children and fight poverty.  She faces hardships of weather changes and inadequate capital to sustain her business. She is in need of a loan to rent land, prepare it, and buy seeds ahead of the planting season.  Gladys is a member of Businge Tukole Group where members guarantee one another to get a loan.

loans.use: to rent land, prepare it, and buy seeds ahead of the planting season

loans.name: Parsaloi

texts.en:
Parsaloi is 36 years old, married, and has children aged between 5 and 14 years of age. He has been a mixed farmer in Narok county, Kenya, for the past 3 years. His monthly income is 10,000 KES.

This is his third loan of 40,000 KES from Vision Fund with which he plans to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. He intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business by increasing the acreage. 

His dream is to have a stable business and improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Letutui

texts.en:
Letutui is a 45-year-old gentleman, married to Christine who is a shop keeper, and a father of twelve children aged between 5 - 19.  He has operated a slaughterhouse in Narok county, Kenya, for the last twenty years with an approximate income of 30,000 KES. He learned about Vision Fund from a neighbor.

He has been advanced a second loan of 30,000 KES which will facilitate him in the purchase and transportation of animals for slaughter. He will use the anticipated proceeds to put up more butcher shops. He hopes to have his own flock of animals to sustain his business.

loans.use: to buy animals for slaughter

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa was born in 1968. She is married and a mother of 6 boys and girls. She has a medium-sized beauty salon where she offers the services of hairstyling. Now she wants to buy new tools for her salon and cosmetic products but she does not have enough money to do so. For this reason, Sanaa is requesting this loan.

loans.use: to buy new tools and cosmetic products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Henry Alexander

texts.es:
Henry es una persona muy dedicada, tiene 30 años de edad y solamente estudió hasta noveno grado en la escuela, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Tienen únicamente una hija que hace poco estuvo muy mal de salud, pues tuvo problemas en el corazón, pero él da gracias a Dios porque afortunadamente, su hija ahora se encuentra mejor.

Henry trabaja como empleado en una plaza comercial, ubicada en la colonia, ahí se desempeña como encargado del mantenimiento y limpieza de la plaza, tiene dos años desempeñándose en esta labor y se ha ganado la confianza de sus jefes. Antes de su actual empleo, Henry se dedicaba a la albañilería, sirviendo como ayudante. 
Se levanta desde muy temprano para emprender cada día el trabajo, para el cual hace un viaje de 7 minutos en bicicleta para llegar a su destino.

Él necesita el crédito, para cancelar una deuda pendiente que tiene con la persona que le prestó dinero para pagar un doctor  privado que atendiera a su hija, cuando ella tuvo problemas de salud con el corazón.

El sueño más  grande de Henry, es tener una casa propia, pues en este momento está alquilando, de esta manera, tendrá techo fijo y estabilidad familiar, logrando que su esposa e hija se sientan satisfechas y gocen de una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Henry is a very dedicated person. He is 30 years old and only studied up to 9th grade in school. He has a partner who does the housework. They only have one daughter who not long ago was very ill with heart problems, but he gives thanks to God because fortunately his daughter is now better. 

Henry is an employee at a mall, located in his neighborhood, where he is responsible for the maintenance and cleaning of the mall. He has worked there for two years and has earned the trust of his employers. Before his current post, Henry worked in construction, as an assistant.

He gets up very early to start work each day, and he bikes 7 minutes to get there.

He needs this loan to cancel a pending debt that he had with a person who lent him the money to pay for a private doctor who cared for his daughter when she had health problems with her heart.

Henry's biggest dream is to have his own home, since at the moment he is renting. In this way he will have a fixed roof and family stability, which will mean that his wife and daughter are happy and can enjoy a better life.

loans.use: to cancel an outstanding debt.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, se casó a la edad de los veinte y cinco  años, a procreo dos  hijos con su pareja, su esposa es ama de casa, ella es la que se encarga de las labores del hogar, sus dos hijos viven con él, la mayor va a noveno y el más pequeño a cuarto grado. Nadie más vive con ellos. 


Él es agricultor, tiene más de veinte años de realizar la actividad, su padre desde pequeño le enseño que la vida solo se vivía bien, si trabajaba honradamente, cuando alguien lo busca que le ayude a trabajar también lo hace, la distancia que recorre es variable; ya que no siempre va al mismo lugar, cuando saca la cosecha una parte la vende y lo demás para el consumo, nadie más se involucra en la actividad, el trabajo lo hace por la mañana de 6:00 am a 12:00 md.


El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una ternera, con lo que mejorara sus activos  y podrá ampliar la producción y tendrá ms ingresos a su hogar, podrá dar un paso de desarrollo para  él y su familia.
 

Su deseo, es que sus hijos crezcan con educación y  poderlos sacar adelante por medio del sacrificio  que incurre tener hijos estudiando, espera que sus hijos se preparen para que un día sean ellos los que le ayuden  en su vejez, todo esto lo logra con la bendición de Dios y su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Juan is 36 years old, and he has studied up to the sixth grade. He married at the age of twenty-five, and he and his wife have two children.  His wife is a homemaker—she is in charge of the housework.  His two children live with him; the oldest is going into the ninth grade and the little one is going into the fourth. No one else lives with them.

He is a farmer, an occupation in which he has been engaged for more than twenty years; his father taught him at an early age that life is only well-lived if it is lived honorably.  He also helps out when people look to him for assistance with their work.  The distance he travels varies, as he doesn’t always go to the same place.  He sells part of his harvest and keeps the rest for consumption. He works alone, from 6:00 a.m. to 12 noon. 

The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of a calf, with which he will be able to improve his assets, increase production, have more income for his home, and take a step toward developing himself and his family.

His wish is that his children grow up with an education, and that he will be able to support them through the sacrifices that he is making in order to keep them in school. He hopes that they will prepare themselves, so that one day they will be the ones who help him in his old age.  With God’s blessing, and his own efforts, he will achieve all of this.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Rosa Andina

texts.es:
Rosa de 57 años de edad, por motivos de distancia a donde estaba la escuela se le imposibilito asistir y desde pequeña ella decidió dedicarse al comercio de ropa.  Es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos uno va a la escuela y el otro no ya que este es un niño con problemas especiales, ellos son los 2 que viven con ella y también el papá de ella y son los que dependen de ella.  

Rosa es una señora con 20 años de experiencia en este negocio de venta de ropa, se dedica a este trabajo, ya que para ella es rentable y a través de este negocio ella obtiene sus ingresos, para ayudarle a sus hijos y también al papá, ella sabe que esta es una forma de trabajar sana para ella, ya que ella trabaja de 6 de la mañana hasta 2 de la tarde en su negocio, 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  para comprar ropa femenina para personas adultas y ropa para niños, ya que ella sale casa por casa a vender, ella comprara camisas, pantalones.

Ella a futuro desea tener en el centro de la comunidad un establecimiento de venta de ropa y así tener un negocio fijo y que le permita día a día, ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 57, due to distance she wasn’t able to go to school and since she was young she decided to sell clothing.  She is a single mother of two, one goes to school and the other one is a boy with special needs, the two boys live with her along with Rosa’s father and they are her dependents.

Rosa has 20 years of experience selling clothes, this is her activity because she considers it profitable and it’s a way for her to get income to help her kids and her dad, she knows that this is activity is good for her, because she works from 6 AM to 2 PM.

The loan requested to CREDICAMPO will be to buy women and children’s clothes that she will sell from door to door.  She will buy shirts and pants.

In the future she wants to have a location downtown to sells clothes and have a business location that allows her to earn a living every day.

loans.use: to buy women and children’s clothes that she will sell from door to door.  She will buy shirts and pants.

loans.name: Manuel Dionicio

texts.es:
Manuel de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, actualmente esta soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres y con su hermano, el cliente es agricultor y aprendió esto porque le ayudaba a su padre a sembrar  maíz, maicillo y hortalizas; tiene además un negocio de venta de pescado que lo compra en playa a una hora de camino desde su casa, lo distribuye transportándose en carro desde las 7 de la mañana hasta que termina el producto y regresa a casa.

El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en pescado para luego revender y otra parte para picar zacate. Con este crédito el espera que su pequeño negocio crezca y la vaya mejor y con las ganancias ir comprando más cantidad, hasta tener un puesto de venta y no estar viajando todos los días.
texts.en:
Manuel is 50 years old and studied up to 6th grade. He is currently single and does not have any children. He lives in his parents house with his brother. Manuel is a farmer and learned this through helping his father to sow corn, sorghum and vegetables. He also has a business selling fish which he buys at the beach an hour away from his house. He distributes it transporting it in his car from 7am until he has run out and he returns home.

Manuel needs the loan to invest in fish to resell and also to grind forage. With this loan he hopes that his small business will grow and get better, and with the income he will be able to buy more and more stock until he has a stall and doesn't have to travel every day.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell and

loans.name: Elevi

texts.es:
Elevi es un hombre de 30 años de edad,  estudio hasta  noveno grado, está acompañado la esposa se dedica a los oficios  domésticos; dos hijos de los tres están en la escuela.

Elevi se dedica la carpintería desde ya hace 7 años,  este oficio lo aprendió de un amigo ya que lo invitaba a que le ayudara en el trabajo y fue así que aprendió  y le gusto ese oficio.  Él solamente a eso se dedica en este trabajo y lo desempeña desde las 7 de la mañana hasta  las 5 de la tarde.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar adobe y tejas para la casa,  ya que donde vive es una parte muy sola y una tía le dono un terreno que  esta más cerca de lo urbano, entonces ahí va a construir su casa para que la familia tenga un hogar muy digno para sus hijos.  El préstamo ayudara mucho, ya que en el invierno tenía muchos problemas que se le mojaba y quiere tener una mejor casa.

Los sueños que tiene es construir una casa muy bonita,  para darle un hogar muy digno a sus  hijos y con su trabajo generar muchos ingresos y seguirlos preparando, ya que han salido muy aplicados en los estudio y quiere aprovechar ese potencial para darles  su apoyo económicamente.
texts.en:
Elevi, 30, studied until the 9th grade and his wife is a stay at home mom. Two of their three children are in school.

Elevi has worked in carpentry for seven years since he learned the skill from his friend who invited him to help at work. Elevi works solely as a carpenter and works from 7 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon.

The loan that he is asking from CREDICAMPO is to buy adobe and roofing tile for his house as he now lives in a very isolate area and an aunt donated a plot of land that is closer to the city. He wants to build a house closer to the city so that his family can have a more dignified home for his children. The loan will help a lot as in the winter he had many problems with all the rains and he wants to have a better house.

One of his dreams is to build a very beautiful house to give a more dignified home for his kids. Another is to gain lots of income from his job and continue preparing his children academically as they have already become very rigorous in their studies and he wants to take advantage of this potential to give them his economic support.

loans.use: to buy adobe and roofing tiles for his home.

loans.name: María Dora

texts.es:
María de 42 años de edad, no estudio, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos, ya que ella no tenia, quien le ayudara para poder estudiar y  decidió poner una pequeña tienda.  Ella adquirió experiencia, cuando le ayudaba  a vender a su tía,  que tenía tienda, el hijo que ella tiene se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura.

Ella tiene 25 años de experiencia, en la venta de artículos de la canasta básica, y le es rentable ya que atreves de las ganancias que ella obtiene ha logrado construir su casita. Dispone de una persona quien le ayuda a vender en su negocio cuando por algún atraso ella no está, y trabaja prácticamente todo el día ya que su negocio lo tiene en su casa.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 5 sacos  de frijoles y 15 quintales de maíz y 2 quintales de arroz.  

Ella desea a futuro disponer de  mercadería  necesaria para venderle a la gente en su comunidad ya que en estos momentos es bien factible el transporte para trasladar la mercadería a su casa, ya que en la época de invierno es muy difícil.
texts.en:
María is 42. She wasn't able to go to school for financial reasons and because she didn't have anyone to help her study, so she decided to set up a small shop. She gained experience in sales by helping out in her aunt's shop. Her son works in agriculture. She has 25 years' experience selling everyday groceries. Her business makes money and, with the profits she makes, she has managed to build her small house. She has someone who helps out in her business if she's not there for some reason, and she works practically all day as the business is in her home.

She is asking for a loan through CrediCampo to buy 5 sacks of beans, 15 hundred-weight of maize and 2 hundred-weight of rice. In the future, she wants to have basic produce to sell to people in her community since currently transport is quite feasible so she can move goods to her house, whereas in the winter it is very difficult.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of beans, 15 hundred-weight of maize and 2 hundred-weight of rice.

loans.name: Sony Group

texts.en:
Johanessen, who is in his early 40s, is single with two children who are still in school.  He has been selling bricks for four years now.  He works from from 7 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Johanessen's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy sand and cement and made a good number of bricks.  He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  He is doing great.  He will use this loan to make more bricks and sell to more customers. He dreams of opening bricks selling business in a different place. 

Johanessen will share this loan with his loan group "Sony" with two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to make more bricks and sell to more customers.

loans.name: Dúo Fatima De Sumpango Group

texts.es:
Dúo  Fátima de Sumpango

Este dúo está conformado por Silvia trabaja se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas ella está solicitando otro crédito para poder invertir en su negocio ella pago muy bien el crédito anterior y promete pagar puntualmente si se le llegara a autorizar este crédito ya que el sueño que ella tiene es que su negocio sea más amplio para poder obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Duo Fátima de Sumpango

This duo is shaped by Silvia. She works by making tortillas. She is requesting another loan to invest in her business; she paid back her previous loan well and promises to pay on time if her new loan is authorized. The dream she has is that her business would grow larger so she can obtain greater earnings.

loans.use: To buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Wakorintho Group

texts.en:
Zuhura, who is in her late 30s, is divorced and has three children who are still going to school. She has been selling fruits, vegetables, and clothes for five years now. She works from 9:00 AM to 9:00 PM daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This loan will be Zuhura's eleventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock out-of-stock vegetables and fruits and to buy clothes to sell. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses. She is happy with the loan. She will use this loan to start selling soft drinks. She dreams of opening a grocery store.

Zuhura will share this loan with her loan group, “WAKORINTHO,” which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling soft drinks.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 48-year-old poultry farmer in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married father of four whose spouse provides additional income and has been in this business for the last twenty-one years.

This marks his first loan to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase chicken feed and medication and will use the anticipated profits to expand his poultry business and repay his loan. He hopes to live a prosperous life in future.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and medication

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 65 years old, married to Mary and they are blessed with four children, three of them are adults and have their own families. He only supports his last born child. He runs a small scale dairy farming business in the Kapsabet area.

He has been in this business for the last five years and he gets an average monthly income of 20,000 KES. He has borrowed a loan of 45,000 KES which he will use to purchase dairy feeds and animal drugs for his cattle. He plans to use the anticipated profits to pay his child's school fees and loan repayment as well as improve his dairy cows for better production.

His dream is to give the best to his family as well as expand his business to a point that he will be financially stable and he also hopes to support his grand-children as well.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feeds and animal drugs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 28 years old and married to John. She supports five members of her family. Margaret runs a boutique business in Eldoret town and is served by VisionFund, Kapsabet branch. She has been in this business for the last three years. From this business she gets a monthly income of KES 28,000.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 40,000 which she will use to purchase new clothes, shoes and sandals among other items that her clients demand. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children, increase her business stock, make some savings and repay her loan.

Her dream is to give the best to her family, meeting the financial needs and giving the best education to her children, expanding her business and opening branches in other nearby towns.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes, shoes and sandals among other items

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to purchase treatments, conditioner, weaves and shampoo for her salon..  She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase treatments, conditioner, weaves and shampoo for her salon..

loans.name: Secundino De Jesús

texts.es:
Secundino es una persona de 55 años de edad,  quien realizo su estudios hasta 9° grado, en la Escuela Nacional, el motivo por el cual ya no pudo seguir sus estudios de educación media, fue porque en esa época no existía el nivel de bachillerato en ese municipio y desde entonces comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura con su padre

Luego con el tiempo trabajo con un amigo de su papá que tenia un taller de mecánica automotriz, trabajo en el taller de mecánica y fue comenzando a descubrir su habilidad para trabajos en mecánica de banco( estructuras metálicas) fue adquiriendo experiencia y monto su propio taller y desde entonces trabaja en su propio taller de estructuras metálicas.  Trabaja de lunes a sábado, en horarios de 8:00am a 4:00pm.
El tiene un hijo de 26 años de edad, que ya formo su propio hogar y eventualmente le ayuda en los trabajos del taller.


 El dinero sera utilizado para comprar hierro, electrodos y pintura, ya que realizara un proyecto en el cual sus contratantes le harán la paga al finalizar al proyecto.
De esta manera prestara un mejor servicio a sus clientes y obtendrá un mejor ingreso que le ayudara a satisfacer las necesidades básicas y al mejoramiento de su vivienda.
 

Las proyecciones que tiene a futuro son las de terminar su vivienda, extender su taller el cual genere empleo para personas que lo necesiten, con ayuda de un crédito comprara mas materiales y herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Secundino, 55, studied through the 9th grade in the Escuela Nacional, because he could not study any further as no level of higher education existed in his area at that time. Since then he began to work in agriculture with his father.

Later, he worked with a friend of his father who had an auto mechanic shop. While working at the shop he discovered his ability for welding metal structures and continued gaining experience until he opened his own shop. Since then he has worked in his own shop of metal structures and works Monday to Saturday from 8am to 4pm.

He has a son who is 26, has his own home and will evidentially help with the shop.
The money will be used to buy steel, electrodes and paint as Secundino is working a project that his contractors will not pay him for until the project is finished. In this way he will provide a better service to his customers and generate a greater income which will him help him meet his basic needs and improve his home.

His future projects are to finish his home, expand his shop which will create employment for those that need it and help his credit to buy more materials and tools for work.

loans.use: to buy steel, electrodes and paint.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María de 36 años de edad, es una mujer que lucha  día con día por su familia, buscando siempre que no les falte al menos  lo básico a sus hijos.  Ella pudo estudiar hasta quinto grado, dejando los estudios porque la situación de pobreza la hizo desplazarse a la capital y trabajar en oficios del hogar en casas de otras personas,  por 12 años. Está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de teja. Sus cuatro hijos viven con ella y están estudiando.

Actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de teja y ayudarle a su marido en las actividades agrícolas en la época lluviosa, aparte de esto realiza los quehaceres del hogar.  El negocio de teja es familiar y trabajan en este, desde diciembre hasta abril (época seca). 

La tejera la tienen en un terreno que alquilan cada año, esta se encuentra a  cuatro cuadras de su casa. La jornada comienza a las 3:00am de la mañana y terminan a las 11:00 am. Luego a las 3:00pm, van a recoger toda la teja elaborada en la mañana.

El crédito lo utilizara  para invertirlo en la compra de materiales (tierra blanca, barro y leña), y también  para el alquiler del terreno donde trabajan.  Necesita tener el capital de trabajo para comenzar, posteriormente con la producción y posterior venta de esta, siguen trabajando sin parar la producción.  Con el préstamo podrá aprovechar la oportunidad de tener mejores ingresos, por la buena época que hay.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y que tengan las posibilidades de poder llegar a la universidad, que se preparen y que sean unos profesionales. Sabe que con el esfuerzo de su esposo y ella podrán sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old. She's a woman who strives for her family on a daily basis and always tries to provide at least basic necessities for her children. She was able to complete 5th grade, but left school because poverty made her move to the capital and work as a housekeeper in other people's homes for 12 years. She's married, and her husband works in agriculture and sells tiles. Her four children live with her and attend school.

Currently, she makes tiles and helps her husband with the farm work during rainy season. Aside from that, she does household chores. Selling tiles is a family business and they work on it from December through April (dry season).

They manufacture the tiles on a plot of land that they rent every year. It's located four blocks away from their home. They start working at 3 a.m. and finish by 11 a.m. Then at 3 p.m. they go and pick up all the tiles they made in the morning.

She'll use the loan to invest in purchasing supplies (white adobe, mud and firewood) and also in paying the rent on the land where they work. She needs to have working capital in order to get started. Later on, with their production and subsequent sales, they'll keep on working with nonstop production. With the loan she'll be able to seize the opportunity to improve her profits, because it's a good time for that.

Her dream is to see her children continue their studies and have the possibility to go to college, get trained and become professionals. She knows that with her own efforts as well as her husband's, they'll be able to get their children ahead.

loans.use: to purchase white adobe, mud and firewood, and to pay for the rent on the land where they work.

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en: Ashkhen is from Brnakot village where she lives with her husband. Their children are married and live separately with their families. Ashkhen and her husband have been running a farm for many years. She is a teacher and works at a local village school, but as her salary is too low for covering the family's living, Ashkhen also helps her husband with agribusiness. The agribusiness helps them to have a stable income during the month so Ashkhen would greatly like to enlarge it. Therefore she has applied for this loan to purchase two calves and grass as forage for the livestock. She has already taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farm is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Ashkhen has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and grass as forage for the livestock

loans.name: Hamu

texts.en: Hamu is a old customer aged 37years old, separated from his wife two years back and has managed to put up a shop where he is getting income for his survival and the survival of his children. He has a retail shop and hopes to expand it - that’s why he requested a loan which he thinks is the starting point. He will use the loan of UGX 2,000,000 to purchase daily household use items like sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil, soft drinks among others so that he can attract a larger clientele. He has a challenge of little business turnover from his commercial businesses and low market purchase, so he decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to increase on output. In the photo is the client and the UGAFODE Credit officer (right to left).

loans.use: To buy more stock of daily household use items like sugar, soap, salt, etc for his retail shop

loans.name: Dinokore Group

texts.en:
Comfort, a member of 'Dinokore' (be truthful) group, is 26 and a married mother with two children who are 5 and 3 years old. Both of her children go to school. She (standing in the middle of the photograph) sells salt door to door. She has been doing this job for seven years to assist her husband who is a taxi driver. As a mother, she would not sit back and leave all the responsibilities on her husband so she saved some money from her previous petty trade, which enabled her to engage in the sale of salt in town. This has enabled her to meet her family's needs. 

Comfort has dreams of expanding her business and educating her children up to higher levels of learning so that they will have a bright future. Comfort lacks enough capital, which has led to the sluggish growth of her business. She, therefore, needs a loan to boost her business. So, together with Abigail and Rebecca, the group needs a total of 1,500 GHS to boost their businesses.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell to customers

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is a 27-year-old man from Kisumu county, and married to Mary who is a business woman in the same county. They have two children ages three and a half and two.

He operates a taxi motorbike business which he has done for the last 7 years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

He is taking his first loan of 30,000 KES with Vision Fund Kenya which he intends to use in expanding his business and part of it to feed his family. The anticipated proceeds will be used to pay the loan and add more shares to Vision Fund Kenya.

His dream is to bring up a stable family.

loans.use: to purchase new spare parts for the motor bike so as to keep it in good condition to enable him give his clients good services

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud was born in 1985. He is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid. Mahmoud has been running his barbershop for 3 years. His work is his only source of income. He took his experience from working at another barber shop, then he opened his own business. Now he needs to buy new chairs for his shop and do some repairs in order to attract more customers, but he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy new chairs for his barbershop

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher is a 42-year-old woman from Siaya county, married to Samuel, who is a civil servant. They have two children, 20 and 22 years old, respectively. 

Jenipher is a tailor, a business she’s done for 19 years now, earning a monthly income of KES 35,000.

This being her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, Jenipher is taking a loan of KES 60,000 to buy a modern machine for sewing clothes. She will use her profits to pay fees for her children, who are in college, and to add savings to VisionFund Kenya.

She has a dream of becoming a super designer in this region.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine with overlock, to give her products a nice finish.

loans.name: Nsagasa Farmers Group

texts.en: Joshua is a promising farmer with children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He grows tomatoes, onions and cabbages plus has a retail shop for additional income. He started this business so as to raise income to meet his family’s increasing demands. He faces a challenge of weather changes and inadequate capital to expand his farming enterprise. However he is determined to educate his children to university. Joshua has asked for a loan to buy sprays for his gardens. He is a member of Nsagasa Farmers Group where members guarantee each other to get a loan as they don't offer security.

loans.use: to buy sprays for his gardens.

loans.name: Gritta

texts.en: Gritta is 30 years old. She is married and has two children. She sells sorghum and has been in the business for the past four years. She makes local beers and juices made from sorghum. Therefore, with this new loan, she would like to buy more sorghum which will be used to make local beers for sale. She plans to use the profits for providing food for the family.  She is happy with the return from the previous loan, which helped in restocking the business.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for making local beers

loans.name: Ráfael

texts.es:
Ráfael de 41 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos son mayores de edad y su otro hijo estudia y lo apoya en el trabajo. 

Desde hace 9 años, tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas, y desde hace dos años tiene un taller de reparación de bicicletas. 
El negocio de estructuras metálicas, lo aprendió por un amigo para quien Ráfael trabajaba hace 15 años en otra ciudad, y vio que donde él vivía, no había este tipo de negocio, además los ingresos eran bastante aceptables, debido a esto Rafael decidió montar su propio taller. 
Además trabajó como mecánico para una empresa, pero por la distancia decidió abandonarlo, ahora también se dedica a transportar alumnos y maestros por la mañana, y después trabaja en  las estructuras metálicas en su en casa.

 El dinero lo utilizará para comprar una hectárea de terreno, pues sueña con estar preparado para que en un futuro sus hijos tengan una vivienda propia y porque seguramente luego de unos años él dependerá de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ráfael, age 41, went to school through the ninth grade.  He is in a relationship, and he has four children.  Three of them are grown, and the other child goes to school.  He helps him with the work.  He has had a metal shop for nine years.  He has had a bicycle repair shop for two years.

He learned the metal business from a friend for whom Ráfael worked 15 years ago in another city.  He saw that there was not this type of business where he lives.  Also, the income was pretty good.  Due to this, Ráfael decided to set up his own shop.

He also worked as a mechanic for a company.  However, he decided to leave that job because of the distance.  He now also transports students and teachers in the mornings.  After that he works with metal at his house.

He will use the money to buy a hectare of land.  He dreams of being prepared so that his children with have a house of their own in the future.  Also, after some  years it will be Ráfael that will be dependent upon his children.

loans.use: to buy a hectare of land.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has operated a cereal shop business, selling household consumables like wheat, beans, rice and MAIZE grains. She cites theft and competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Florence is requesting 65,000 KES to boost her cereal business, purchase bundles of wheat, beans, maize, and rice for sale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat, beans, maize, and rice for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Vincent's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 8 group leader farmers in Busia District with Vincent selected as the Kiva representative.  Vincent has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 72 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Vincent is married and has 4 children.  He is 61 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee.  Vincent has been a farmer for 7 years.  Vincent harvest was not with One Acre Fund last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

The 2014 Long Rains season will be Vincent’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He joined this year in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family, and send his children to school.  As an active member in his community, Vincent also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and as an active community member, he wants to help more farmers, and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Vincent plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund.
														
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Vincent and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Berfalia

texts.es:
Berfalia de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, no está casada y tiene tres hijos, uno de ellos trabaja adiestrando caballos, su hija ya se casó y solo depende de ella su hijo menor, que actualmente, se encuentra estudiando bachillerato.

Ella se dedica al destazo, lo hace todos los martes de cada semana, tiene tres años de dedicarse a esta actividad, pues fue de su madre quien aprendió este trabajo, con el tiempo le fue gustando y es por ello que decidió dedicarse a este negocio y porque además, le genera buenos ingresos. Su hijo menor es quien se involucra y le apoya en este trabajo.

El préstamo lo invertirá en la construcción de una vivienda, y así poder vivir en un ambiente agradable y adecuado con su hijo.

Ella sueña con que su hijo continúe sus estudios, y verlo convertirse en un profesional,  ayudándole en todo lo que sea necesario.
texts.en:
Berfalia, age 39, went to school through the seventh grade.  She is not married, and she has three children.  One of them works training horses.  Her daughter got married.  Only her minor son is dependent upon her.  He is currently going to high school.

She butchers meat.  She does this every Tuesday of every week.  She has been doing this for three years.  She learned this work from her mother.  As time passed, she liked it.  That is why she decided to devote herself to this business.  Also, it generates good income for her.  Her youngest son is involved in this work, and he helps her.

She will use the loan to build a house.  This way she will be able to live in a pleasant and adequate environment with her son.

She dreams of her son continuing his education and seeing him become a professional.  She will help him with everything that he needs.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a widow and has four children who are all in school. Her main source of income is cattle fattening, and sales from milk. 

Faith has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to help her buy more cows for milk production. This she thinks will increase her income and she will take her children to good schools. Her main challenge is raising money to pay tuition for her children and provide their basic needs, since she does this single-handedly.

Faith is a very hard working and honest woman who is striving hard to provide a good standard of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 37 years old and married to Eunice and they are blessed with five children between the ages of 4 and 13 years. He runs a power-saw services business and also sells timber in the Kapsabet area of Kenya. He has been in this business for the last four years; from this he earns a monthly net profit of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

William has requested a loan of 45,000 KES, which he will use to purchase spare parts for his power saw and also buy trees to be milled into timbers. He will use the profits he anticipates to repay the loan and pay his children's school fees as well as buy a dairy cow for his family.

William's dream is to provide the best for his family as the breadwinner as well as to expand his business to a point where he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy trees for timber.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 46-year-old lady from Kisumu, and is married to Juma who is a civil servant.  They have one child aged 14.  She operates a salon, a business she’s done for two years now earning a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

She is taking a loan of 50,000 KES, this being her third loan with Vision Fund Kenya to use in buying a blow drier and chemicals. She will use her profits to upgrade her salon.

She dreams of bringing up a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her salon

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is aged 28. He is single, and sells cooking oil and rice. He has been in the business for three years. He has requested the loan, to buy more cooking oil, rice, and other items that can be restocked for sale. He plans to use the profits for building a house. He is very happy with the past loan, which helped in boosting his retail business.

loans.use: to buy more saucepans, soap, and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Hottensiah

texts.en:
Hottensiah is a single lady of fifty five years. She lives with three people who are all over eighteen years, but provides them with food and shelter. She sells potatoes in Ruaka in the outskirt of Kiambu.  She has been in this business for eight years now and earns a monthly income of ten thousand shillings.

This will be Hottensiah's fourth loan with Vision Fund Kenya.  She plans to use the whole loan to buy potatoes in bulk for resale.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes in bulk

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 26-year-old lady from Kisumu county, and is married to Harry who is also a business man in the same town. They have three children aged 8,12 and 1.  She operates a salon business and has done this for the last 5 years earning an average income of 20,000 KES per month. 

She is taking her third loan of 60,000 KES with Vision Fund Kenya to buy salon equipment and chemicals. The profits will be used to repay the loan and to add into her savings.

Her dream is to prosper and bring up a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals in bulk to use on clients' hair

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo es una persona de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado en el centro escolar de la comunidad, durante su infancia se creció al lado de sus padres y sus nueve hermanos mayores que él. A los 15 años emigro hacia los estados unidos de América, donde trabajo por diez años muy duro para ayudar a su familia, gracias a su esfuerzo logro construir su propia vivienda, luego regreso a su lugar de origen donde ahora trabaja a lado de sus padres en la albañilería, en la venta de hierro y elaboración de cumas.
Su esposa con quien se acompaño hace 2 años, tiene un niño de 1 año de edad, ella trabaja en la venta de tortillas de maíz en la comunidad.

Reinaldo trabaja en la albañilería, su padre y unos amigos de su lugar le apoyaron y así logro aprender y trabajar por cuenta propia. Además, vende hierro pues en la zona donde vive hay pequeñas artesanías que se dedican a la elaboración de cumas y el vende el hierro, también con su padre elabora las cumas, durante los seis días a la semana desde las tres y media de la mañana para luego comercializarlas en la ciudad, su padre le ayuda en los trabajos.
Reinaldo tambien trabaja en la agricultura (siembra de maíz y frijoles) y la ganadería en pequeña escala, le han enseñado sus padres, pues ellos tienen un pequeño hato ganadero.

Reinaldo solicita un crédito en credicampo, para la compra de una vaca lechera, valorada en $600.00 la comprara en la comunidad. 
También comprara 20 quintales de hierro valorados en $40 cada uno, con lo cual el podrá venderlos en la comunidad, pues esta cerca la temporada donde se vende mas hierro, ya que las personas del lugar y zonas aledañas se están preparando para las siembras de los cultivos.
Sueña con tener mucha salud, para darle lo mejor a su hijo y a su esposa, por leso trabaja todos los días para obtener ganancias y así en el futuro hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is 34 years old. He completed second grade at the community school. As a child, he grew up with his parents and his nine older siblings. At age 15, he emigrated to the United States of America, where he works very hard for 10 years so he could help his family. Thanks to his efforts, soon he was able to build his own house. He soon came back to his hometown where he currently works alongside his parents in masonry, selling iron and manufacturing sickles.
His wife, whom he's been living with for two years, has a one-year-old baby boy. She sells corn tortillas in the community.

Reinaldo works in masonry. His father and some of his local friends helped him, and thus he successfully learned and became self-employed. In addition, he sells iron, because in the area where he lives there are small shops that manufacture sickles and he sells the iron. He also makes sickles alongside his father six days a week, beginning at 3:30 a.m., so he can sell them in town. His father helps him in this line of work.

Reinaldo also works in agriculture (he grows corn and beans) and raises cattle on a small scale. This was taught to him by his parents, because they own a small herd of cattle.

Reinaldo is requesting a loan from CrediCampo so he can purchase a dairy cow which is valued at U$ 600.00. He'll buy it in his community.
He'll also purchase 20 quintals of iron which are valued at U$ 40.00 each. He'll be able to sell them in the community, because the upcoming season is the one when iron sales are highest, since people from that area and from neighboring areas are getting ready to sow their crops.
He dreams of having plenty of health so he can provide the best for his son and his wife. That's why he works every day in order to obtain profits and therefore do some home improvements someday.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and 20 quintals of iron.

loans.name: Delmi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Delmi de 46 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de campo, tienen cuatro hijos y ninguno vive con ellos, solamente una nieta que aún no va a la escuela. 

Ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la agricultura, pues fue de su familia que aprendió este trabajo, saber de esta actividad le ayudó de mucho a Delmi, pues gracias a ello ahora  le ayuda a su pareja en la siembra agrícola, además destaza reses y es un ingreso extra que le sirve para seguir trabajando.

Ella necesita este crédito, para pagar a los mozos, para picar zacate, desgranar maicillo, y para comprar una máquina para elaborar el trabajo, y con el resto comprar un par de novillos.

Sus sueños son reproducir los novillos, empezar un negocio de ganadería con su pareja, y las ganancias las invertiría en comprar más animales para ejecutar dicho negocio.
texts.en:
Delmi, 46, studied until the 6th grade and is married to her husband who works in the fields. They have four children, none of whom live with them, except for a granddaughter who does not go to school yet.

She works around the house and in agriculture as she learned this work from her family. Knowing agriculture has helped Delmi a lot as she is able to help her husband in agricultural planting, as well as butchering cattle and it is an extra income that helps her to keep working.

Delmi needs this loan to pay workers to cut the grass and shell maicillo and to buy a machine to produce the work. With the rest she will buy a pair of steers.

Her dream is to breed the steers and start a livestock business with her husband. She will invest the profits into buying more animals to run the business.

loans.use: to pay workers to cut grass, shell maicillo, buy machinery and a pair of steer.

loans.name: Raheal

texts.en:
Raheal is a 54-year-old lady from Kakamega county who is married to Kennedy and in formal employment in the same region.  Together they are blessed with four children ages 17,14,13 and 5 years old respectively. She sells cereals in her business, which she has done for 5 years, making a monthly income of KES 7,500.

She is taking KES 15,000 as her fifth loan with Visionfund Kenya, which she intends to use in expanding her current business. The anticipated profits are to be used in paying fees for her children and part of it will be plugged back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 38-year-old father of seven children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer and also owns a cassava milling machine to supplement his income. He ventured into this business in order to get income to pay school fees for all his children since he didn't attain education. However, he faces a challenge of inadequate capital for expansion and the unpredictable weather changes. His dream is to become a model farmer in his area and educate his children to university level. Alex needs the loan to buy Irish potatoes and onion seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes and onion seeds for planting.

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María de 51 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, actualmente está casada y su pareja es agricultor, tiene 11 hijos, cinco de ellos estudian en la universidad, los demás trabajan y otros viven en el exterior.

Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace dos años, también trabaja en el destazo desde hace 5 años, ella sale a vender chicharrones en la comunidad donde reside, su rutina diaria de trabajo es variada, pero por lo general es de 9:00 AM. a 5:00 PM.

María necesita de este préstamo, para comprar ganado, específicamente dos reses, pues piensa reproducirla y en un futuro incrementar el negocio de destazo.

Sus sueños son, que sus hijos terminen de estudiar su carrera universitaria y puedan ser independientes; y también sueña que su negocio siga creciendo y esto le permita comprar más ganado.
texts.en:
Maria, 51, studied until third grade.  She is now married and her husband is a farmer.  They have 11 children.  Five of them study at university; the rest of them work, some abroad.

She has been selling tortillas for two years.  She has also worked in the slaughterhouse for five years and she sells pork rinds in the area where she lives.  Therefore her daily routine is quite varied, but in general she works from 9 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon.

Maria needs this loan to buy cattle, specifically two cows.  She plans to have them reproduce and therefore increase the business in the slaughterhouse in the future.

She dreams of seeing her children finish their studies and becoming independent.  She also hopes to see her business continue to grow which will allow her to buy more cattle.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives in Lor village with her grandparents-in-law and two children ages 6 and 3 years old. Narine's husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country and helps support his family financially.   

Her grandparents-in-law are retired and Narine has to take care of them, two children and also the household. Narine works at a local school as a teacher and after work runs a small farm. This hardworking woman does her best to run the farm in a sustainable way insuring a stable income from it. 

Narine now asks for this loan to be able to enlarge her farm. She plans to purchase a piglet, forage for the livestock, and 8 colonies of bees. The loan will be a huge support for the farm and Narine will be very grateful to lenders for support.

loans.use: to pay for a piglet, forage for the livestock, and 8 colonies of bees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice operates a Kiosk business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. 
	
With the loan that she is requesting of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and wheat flour for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and wheat flour

loans.name: Petronilo

texts.es:
Petronilo de 61 años de edad, desafortunadamente no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar en la escuela, pero por otros medios aprendió a leer y escribir, él está viudo, vive con todos sus 8 hijos y los dos menores se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.

Él se ha dedicado toda su vida  a la agricultura, pues lo aprendió de su padre, además tiene otras actividades económicas que le permiten sacar adelante a sus hijos. Petronilo tiene una pequeña tienda en la que sus hijos lo apoyan cuando él está trabajando en la agricultura, camina 10 minutos para llegar al campo y dos hijos más le ayudan en esta actividad.

Petronilo necesita mucho de este crédito, para construir una casa de adobe para su hija y ocupa materiales para poder realizarlo, por tanto el crédito le permitirá comprar los materiales que necesita.

Sus sueños son que cada hijo tenga casa propia, ya que donde él vive hay espacio suficiente para poder construirlas, y que sus hijos menores sigan adelante con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Petronilo, 61, unfortunately did not have the chance to go to school.  However, he did learn to read and write by other means.  He is a widower and lives with his eight children, two of whom are studying at school.

He has worked in agriculture all his life, after learning the trade from his father.  He also has other activities that help him look after his children.  Petronilo has a small shop which his children look after when he is working in the fields.  He walks ten minutes to get to his place of work and is helped there by two of his children. 
 
He really needs this credit to build an adobe house for his daughter and buy the materials he needs to do it.  He hopes that all his children will have their own house in the future, which is possible given that on the land where he lives there is plenty of space for building them.  He also hopes that his younger children continue with their studies.

loans.use: to build an adobe house.

loans.name: Arevhat

texts.en:
Arevhat lives in Spitak town with her husband. Their children are migrant workers in a neighboring country, trying to support their parents financially. Arevhat and her husband have been running a farm for 20 years already. They own a car which her husband drives as a taxi. However, the main income of the family comes from agricultural business. Arevhat keeps livestock and cultivates potatoes and cabbages. The gathered harvest is sold locally so the family earns its living. 

Arevhat has applied for this loan to be able to purchase grass as forage for the livestock. She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farm is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Arevhat has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for grass as forage for their livestock

loans.name: Fatuk Boot Group

texts.en: Belina is one of the members of Fatuk Boot Group, Fatuk Boot means Big Rock. There are six members in Fatuk Boot Group and each member is taking out a loan of $500. Belina is using her loan to buy fresh fish. She dries it with salt and sells it again at a good price. She is earning a good income from doing this business. She started to do this business in 2011 with her own working capital of $200.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and salt in order to dry the fish and sell it again.

loans.name: Ángel De Jesús

texts.es:
Ángel de 36 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos que estudian en la escuela, él es empleado  y también trabaja la tierra, ambas actividades le generan buenos ingresos para su familia.

Él necesita este crédito, para trabajar la tierra en el cultivo de maíz, ya que el salario que obtiene de su trabajo lo invierte en el consumo del hogar y no le es suficiente para invertir en la agricultura.

Él sueña con dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar, para que logren ser profesionales y ganarse la vida de una manera más tranquila.
texts.en:
Angel, 36, finished his high school studies.  He is married and has two children who are studying at school.  He is an employee and he also works in the fields.  Both of these jobs provide him with a good income to support his family.

He needs this loan to prepare the land for growing corn, because the money he earns all goes on household expenses and he doesn’t have any left over to invest in agriculture.

He dreams of giving his children the opportunity to continue their studies and become good professionals who can earn a living in more suitable ways.

loans.use: to invest in agriculture, growing corn.

loans.name: Calisto's Group

texts.en:
Calisto is a member of this group in Busia District. He is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 58 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Calisto has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and he is standing on the right with his hand raised. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo. 

Calisto and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of KES 5,349 (shillings) for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Calisto is married and has nine children. He is 59 years old and is known as friendly, hard-working, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer. He is active in his community, in groups such as the men's group, prayer group, and burial committee. Calisto has been a farmer for 20 years. He was not with One Acre Fund last year, but believes he can have an even better harvest this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.
  							
The 2014 Long Rains season will be Calisto’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He joined this year in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough money to feed his family and send his children to school. As an active member in his community, Calisto also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member, who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Calisto plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future, and buy a pig.  He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money, and feed the family.							
						
Calisto and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers, through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Kyamukube Bakyara Nabasaija Tweyimukye Group.

texts.en:
Jane is a hardworking woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda where she has been dealing in fresh food and produce selling since 2009 to support her family. She carries out farming too and hopes to have enough produce to educate her Children despite the high transport costs to transport the produce to her customers. Jane is asking for a loan to buy fresh foods and produce to sell. 

She is a member of Kyamukube Bakyara Nabasaija Tweimukye Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge security.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods and produce products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for renovations, building an interior plaster wall, shelving, a picture window, painting, supplies and materials.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
