Christopher, a hardworking father of five who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda, has been in the farming business since 1990. Agriculture has enabled him to support his family and improve his financial status. His main challenges are weather changes and constant price fluctuations.

Like all loving fathers, Christopher has as a priority his children's education so that they can eventually achieve a level of independence and sustainability. He is now requesting a loan to help pay their school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman and has been blessed with kids. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for her kids.

For the past four years, she has operated a cereal shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of 25,000 KES, she wants to purchase wheat, maize, beans and rice to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, maize, beans, and rice to sell

loans.name: Marmel Emilio

texts.es:
Marmel de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado de nivel académico,  está acompañado la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos; dos hijos están en la escuela, con Marmel solamente vive con  sus padre y madre y sus dos hijos y la esposa por lo tanto solamente ellos dependen de él.


Marmel se dedica la agricultura desde ya hace 7 años de edad,  oficio que aprendió del papá,  ya que desde pequeño le ha inculcado y desde entonces él se ha dedicado a la agricultura; solamente a esto se dedica el trabajo le queda a una distancia de 15 minutos  a pie cerca le queda el trabajo y se involucra su papá y un hermano y el horario que tiene es de las seis de la mañana a las doce del mediodía.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para sacar los cultivos,  ya que aún no ha terminado de sacar el maíz y el tiempo siente que ya lo absorbió,  entonces es así que quiere poner personas que le ayuden pero también Marmel con lo restante comprara puertas para la casa que ha hecho con mucho sacrificio, esto ayudara mucho ya que terminara la casa y sacara los cultivos para tenerlos en la casa.

Los sueños que posee,  es terminar su casa , sacar los cultivos y poder sacar a sus hijos adelante cuando ellos ya estudien poder darles su  apoyo y seguir ayudándole  a su papá,  ya que el esta mayor de edad y siempre lo apoyare
texts.en:
Marmel is 31 years old, and he has studied up to the ninth grade. He lives with his wife, who takes care of the house. They have two children who attend school. Marmel’s mother and father live with him, in addition to his wife and children, and they all depend on him.

Marmel has been working in agriculture since he was 7 years old—an occupation that he learned from his father, who taught him at a very young age.  Since that time he has only worked in agriculture. His work is a walking distance of about 15 minutes, and his father and brother work with him. He works from six in the morning until twelve noon. 

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is for harvesting the crops, as he has not yet finished picking the corn and he feels that he has already used up the time; therefore he wants to hire people to help him.  With what is left over, he wants to purchase doors for the house that he has built by making many sacrifices. This will be a great help to him in harvesting his crops and completing his house, so that he can keep his harvest there. 

The dreams that he has are to be able to complete his house, harvest his crops, and raise his children. Also, he wants to support his children who are already in school, and continue to help his father—who is already elderly—whom he will always support.

loans.use: To purchase doors for his house and store his corn harvest there.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
This group consists of three members, namely Lydia, Mary and Patricia, who reside in Dansoman. They are part of a main group called 'Ebenezer'. Lydia sells materials, Mary sells second-hand clothing, while Patricia sells plantains. 

Patricia is a 32-year-old plantain trader. She is married and has two children. She sells plantains and has 10 years of experience. She works from Monday to Saturday. She gets her goods from the foodstuffs market and sells in the Dansoman community. This is her second loan with ID Ghana and she needs a loan of GHS 600 to buy more goods to sell to her customers. The entire group needs an amount of GHS 1500 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en: Fatma appreciates the Kiva and Yehu support. The previous loans helped her to purchase a freezer which she uses in her business.  Here again, she comes to you requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase goods for her business to ensure that she attracts customers with her good service.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her business

loans.name: Yanira Emperatriz

texts.es:
Yanira tiene 41 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, ella es madre soltera, pues su esposo la abandonó cuando su hijo tenía 6 años, pero con esfuerzo está sacando adelante a su hijo, él está estudiando, pues ha iniciado una carrera en la universidad 

Yanira es promotora de salud desde hace 20 años, ella manifiesta que gracias a un amigo de su padre consiguió este trabajo, ella trabaja 8 horas diarias pero en realidad son mas porque en ocasiones hasta en la noche le corresponde atender a sus pacientes, pero dice que lo hace con mucho gusto porque se siente bien ayudando a la gente, sin importar el horario, ademas en ocasiones tiene que caminar hasta 8 horas cuando hay que vacunar a los niños y atender a mujeres embarazadas.

El crédito lo invertirá para dar un adelanto en la universidad y pagar el alquiler donde se quedará su hijo, ya que la universidad está lejos y no puede estar viajando, por tanto debe alquilar un lugar donde quedarse. 

Su sueño, es ver a su hijo convertirse en un excelente doctor ya que esa es la carrera que él decidió estudiar, y ella lo apoya incondiconalmente, pues siempre soñó con ser una enfermera, pero no lo  logró. Sueña con comprarle una casa mas cerca de la universidad y no tenga que estar viajando hasta donde vive actualmente..
texts.en:
Yanira, 41, studied until the end of high school.  She is a single mother; her husband left her when her son was six years old.  With a lot of dedication, she is raising her child and he is now starting at university.

Yanira has been a health worker for 20 years.  She got her job thanks to a friend of her father.  She officially works eight hours a day but in reality it is more because sometimes she has to stay with her patients at night.  However, she says that she enjoys doing it because it gives her great satisfaction to be helping people, no matter what time it is.  Besides this, at times she has to walk for up to eight hours when she has to give vaccines to children or attend to pregnant women.

She will invest the loan in making a down payment at the university and settling the rent where her son is going to stay.  He has to stay there because the university is a long way away and he cannot commute every day.

Her dream is to see her son become an excellent doctor, which is his chosen area of study.  She gives him her unconditional support because she always wanted to be a nurse herself, a goal she was unable to achieve.  She would also like to buy a house nearer the university so they don’t have to travel so far to see each other.

loans.use: to pay for university studies.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise lives in the Homa Bay area of Kenya. Homa Bay county is located in southwestern Kenya and borders on Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing and a few work in the small, but slowly-growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.  

Loise is married and has six children. She has been farming mangoes, pawpaw, citrus, avocado, maize, beans, and millet for eight years. She is excited to start beekeeping because she loves honey and it will earn her money she can use for household expenses. Loise will use the expected profits to start a small posho mill (grain grinding) business.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent comes from a rural cell (neighborhood) in Ibanda district. He is married with four children who are all in school. 

Innocent runs a retail shop with small capital and does agriculture as his side source of income. His customers are his neighbors. He has applied for a loan of UGX.2,000,000 to help him add more stock to his business and use the rest of the money to pay tuition for his children. He would like to expand his business and operate on a large scale. Innocent is a very honest and trustworthy man.

He hopes to construct a permanent home for his children in the near future.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bath and washing soap, toothpaste, coal, and other items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to clean his six acres of mature cacao trees.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en: Tariq was born in 1993. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his parents and two siblings. Tariq started running his project of car tire repair four months after he noticed the financial crisis his family was facing. Now he needs to buy more car tires to expand his business and raise his profit but he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy car tires and jacks for his business

loans.name: Renata

texts.en:
Renata, 32, lives alone in a house lent by a friend. She is a creative girl who loves fashion, clothing and healthy food. She's after the dream of having her own business. 
She's done fashion college and began her business selling embellished T-shirts she created herself. Today, she is a minority partner in a clothing store, but still can not keep up and needs financial help from friends. So she had the idea of ​​doing an in-store company that has a space for healthy snacks, so she can attract customers in the store and the public nearby. She will pay a low value for the lease of space for the coffee. She needs the money to make the purchase of a small stock of healthy foods and also tables and chairs.

loans.use: To make the purchase of a small stock of healthy foods and also tables and chairs

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 41 años de edad,  estudió hasta sexto grado, pues debido a la pobreza tuvo que dejar de estudiar, está casado y tienen 4 hijos, una hija ya está acompañada, 3 están estudiando y viven en casa.

Él se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde que tenía 10 años, pues su papá siempre le dijo que era bueno estudiar, pero que era mejor aprender a defenderse para cuando tuviera su hogar pudiera sacarlo adelante, hoy agradece a su padre por haberle enseñado esta ocupación.

Él es un hombre muy trabajador, se levanta muy de mañana para prepararse e irse al trabajo, pues le queda a 30 minutos de su casa. Mientras él trabaja en la agricultura, sus hijos llevan el ganado al potrero y luego se van a la escuela. 
Alfredo trabaja 7 horas y luego regresa a su casa, porque por la tarde tiene que ir a traer a su esposa en una motocicleta a 8 kilómetros de su casa. 

El crédito será invertido en la reparación de la motocicleta, ya que se le arruinó debido a que tuvo un accidente y es con la que transporta a su esposa al trabajo.

Él sueña con que sus hijos logren graduarse en una profesión universitaria, ya que lamentablemente él no lo logró, también espera construir una casa, pues donde vive ahora está en muy malas condiciones, además desea comprar unas 10 vacas lecheras y pagar el crédito para seguir trabajando con está institución.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 41, had to stop studying after sixth grade due to his family’s situation of poverty.  He is married and has four children.  One of his daughters is also married; the other three are studying and live in his house.

He has worked in agriculture and livestock since he was 10 years old.  His father always told him that while it was good to study, it was also important to learn to look after yourself for when you have a household to take care of.  He is very grateful to his father for having taught him this profession.

He is very hard-working, getting up very early and getting ready to go to work.  It takes him 30 minutes to get there.  While he is working in agriculture, his children take the cattle to the meadow before going to school.  Alfredo works for seven hours before returning home, because he has to go and pick up his wife 8 km from home.  

He needs this loan to repair the motorcycle which he uses to take his wife to work.  It needs repairing after he had an accident on it.  

He dreams of seeing his children graduate from university, something which he unfortunately was not able to achieve.  He also hopes to build a new house as the one where he lives now is in a very bad condition.  He would like to buy ten cows, too, and pay off this loan so that he can carry on working with this organization.

loans.use: to repair a motorcycle.

loans.name: José Benjamín

texts.es:
José es un joven  de 27 años de edad,  estudio hasta séptimo grado. Es casado la esposa se desempeña los quehaceres del hogar, aún no han procreado hijos.

José trabaja en la agricultura desde que era un niño,  el papá lo llevaba al campo a trabajar , fue así que él se dedica a  este oficio;  también José visita una iglesia por medio de esa iglesia lo han mandado a una radio a pasar un programa cristiano de esto no genera un ingreso, pero si de vez en cuando le dan una ofrenda para el combustible.

Para desempeñar el trabajo agrícola, debe viajar  en motocicleta, solamente él y un hermano trabajan en eso el horario es de seis de la mañana a once del medio día. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una motocicleta  para viajar al programa de radio,  él viaja siempre en una motocicleta que tiene; pero siente que ya está muy viejita y tiene miedo que por la moche que se viene de ese programa lo deje en la calle y se le arruine y así como está la delincuencia no le parece quedarse en las noches,  así la necesidad  que será satisfecha es que tendrá su  propio transporte más nuevo 
Uno de sus sueños es poder estudiar y prepararse,  ya que antes por estar en la agricultura no pudo seguir estudiando y así  prepararme para locutor y también para pastor evangélico,  que sabe  que ese camino es el mejor y poder procrear su  familia y enseñarle un buen camino en las cosas de Dios.
texts.en:
Jose is a 27-year-old young man, he studied up to 7th grade.  He is married, his wife works at home, they don’t have children yet.

Jose works in agriculture since he was a child, his father took him with him to work the land, this is how he got into this activity;  Jose also visits a church through which he was invited to a Christian radio show, this doesn’t generate any income for him but once in a while he gets a donation for fuel.
To perform his job, he has to travel through motorcycle, he and his brother work a schedule from 6 AM to 11AM.

The loan requested to CREDICAMPO is to buy a motorcycle to travel to the radio show, he always travels in a motorcycle he has, but it is getting really old and he is concerned that it will break down at night when he is returning from the show. Due to the crime situation he wants to prevent this from happening and needs to have a new transportation vehicle.

One of his dreams is to study and prepare, before working in agriculture he wasn’t able to continue his studies.  He would like to be an announcer and an evangelical pastor, he believes that is the best road to take to be able to have a family and show them God’s way.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spareribs and pigs' feet for her business.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila de 56 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de educación básica, está soltera y todos sus hijos ya están acompañados.

Ella se dedica  a los oficios domésticos, además tiene  una pequeña tienda desde hace tres años, pues vive sola y decidió dedicarse a esta actividad, para poder sostenerse y que no le falte lo necesario en su hogar.

La señora Zoila,  necesita de este crédito, parareparar el techo de su casa, pues desea invertir el dinero en su vivienda y espera tener un hogar en condiciones adecuadas.

Ella sueña con tener una vivienda digna, para que sus hijos tengan un lugar propio donde vivir, ya que actualmente  todos alquilan casa.
texts.en:
Zoila is 56 years old. She studied until the third grade of elementary school. She is unmarried and all her children are in relationships.

Her job is doing housework. She also has had a small shop for three years. Because she lives alone, she decided to pursue this activity in order to sustain herself and not be without the necessities for her home.

Ms. Zoila needs this loan to repair the roof of her house because she wants to invest the money in her home and hopes to keep it in fair condition.

She dreams of having a decent home for her children so that they have a proper place to live as they are currently renting.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en: Rudy owns and operates a motorcycle for transportation services to earn a living. After many years in service, he now earns a better income to support his children's education. He has successfully repaid his previous loan used for buying spare parts and tires. Recently, he took a new loan to cover maintenance costs and license renewal. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to cover maintenance costs and license renewal.

loans.name: Rubia Cándida

texts.es:
Rubia de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casada y tiene un hijo que vive con ellos, el esposo vende celulares en el mercado del pueblo, su hijo asiste a parvularia y ella vive en casa de su madre.

Ella y su esposo tienen un año de dedicarse a la venta de teléfonos celulares, ella decidió trabajar en el comercio de celulares pues notó que el negocio era bueno, además le queda cerca de su casa ya que está a dos cuadras de donde ella vive.

Rubia necesita de este crédito, para comprar más teléfonos y surtir el negocio, de esta forma obtendrá mayores ingresos, y por ende podrá darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y todo lo que necesite.

Ella sueña con tener una casa en mejores condiciones para su hijo o futuros hijos, que su pequeño hijo siga estudiando hasta llegar a ser un profesional, ya que esa es la mejor herencia que le puede dar, con el crédito ella esperar hacer crecer el negocio, lo que le generará mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
34-year-old Rubia studied up to the ninth grade. She is married and has a son who lives with them. Her husband sells mobile phones in the village market. Her son is in kindergarten and she lives in her mother’s house.

She and her husband have been selling mobile phones for a year. She decided to work in this area because she noticed that the business was good and it is close to her house, as it is only two blocks away from where she lives.

Rubia needs this loan in order to purchase more phones and restock her business so that she can obtain greater revenue and give her son a better quality of life and everything he needs.

She dreams of having a house in better condition for her son and future children, and of her son continuing to study until he becomes a professional, since this is the best inheritance she can give him. She expects to make her business grow with the loan, which will enable her to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more phones and restock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire workers to clean cacao trees.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in the Homa Bay area of Kenya. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya and borders on Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small, but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.  

Paul is married and has five children. He has been farming for twenty years, and is currently growing mangoes, papayas, citrus, avocados, maize, beans, and millet on his land. 

Paul is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper, as his bees will pollinate his crops, and he will have honey to eat. He plans to use the profits from his hives to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Al-Tahady Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Tahady and consists of four ladies. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. All of them are responsible and honored to get a better life for their families. They requested a loan of 200,000 Yemen Rials (YER).  

Jamila is 43 years old and the leader of this group. She works untiringly to provide sustenance for her family. Jamila is selling phones and mobile recharging cards, a business she uses to provide for her family. 

She would like to improve her business and stock more merchandise to sell, and be able to increase her earnings. She is now borrowing a loan from AMB to buy mobile recharging cards to sell to her customers. She hopes to expand her business to open a phone accessories business to get more profit.

loans.use: to buy mobile recharging cards to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an iron, table and sewing machine.

loans.name: Alexandrina

texts.en:
Alexandrina lives in a town which is about 87 km from the capital. She is a business woman so she always finds ways to improve her business.

Alexandrina has a kiosk that she opened a year ago. She started to do business with her own working capital of $100. She is also selling bread, fried bananas and doughnuts, so she will use the loan to buy goods to keep in her store such as cane milk, biscuits, candies, sugar, coffee and flour.

loans.use: to buy cane milk, biscuits, candies, sugar, coffee and flour

loans.name: Agrepina

texts.en:
Agrepina is requesting a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent and other things to sell as well as flour to make fried bananas.

Agrepina started to open her kiosk in 2001 with her own working capital of $40. She is happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent and other things to sell as well as flour to make fried bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice, salt, oil, etc.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: This is 28-year-old Zainab. She is married and has 1 child, aged 6 years. In 2000, Zainab established her grocery business. She began her business to assist her family and her husband in the running of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of town and her main customers are all class of people.   Working 7 days a week and 18 hours a day, she earns about SLL 300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Zainab requires a loan in order to purchase more stock for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to aid in expanding her business. In the future, Zainab plans to buy a piece of land together with her husband to construct a 3 bedroom flat and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana lives on an island and most of her daily income is from selling fish and sea weeds. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is now applying for a loan of $700. She will use the loan to buy fishing net and other materials for her husband to do his activities as a fisherman. She will bring the fish that her husband gets to the market to sell.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other materials to catch fish

loans.name: Lundaajantsan

texts.en:
Mr. Lungaajaltsan, 57 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling second-hand clothes to local people for nine years. His wife has a position as a consultant at a cosmetics firm. 

Using his previous loan, he has bough many clothes and increased his revenue. This time he is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to buy clothes in large quantities from China to have in stock. As a result, he can continue to run his business without worrying about inventory shortage. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy clothes in large quantities.

loans.name: Alnit

texts.en:
Alnit is 53 years old, married, and the mother of two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Alnit has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Alnit has been in this business for two years. In the future, Alnit would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
Erica is 54 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. Erica works very hard to provide for them.

Erica runs a business buying and selling gasoline in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Erica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: This is 47-year-old Abdul. He is married and has four children aged 23, 19, 16, and 13. In 2001, Abdul established his drinks business to generate funds to support his children's education. His business is located in the outskirts of town and his main customers are local men and women. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) every month from this business. Abdul has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan of 5,000,000 SLL in order to buy stocks of stout (1,500,000 SLL), star beer (1,000,000 SLL) and soft drinks (500,000 SLL). He hopes that this loan will increase his stock level and hence his income. In the future, Abdul plans to educate his children, succeed as a distributor for a brewery, and develop his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drinks for his business.

loans.name: Leotelia

texts.en: Leotelia is requesting a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. Francisca started to open her kiosk in 2007 with her own working capital of $500. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent and other things.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. Francisca started to open her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of 1,000 USD. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en: Ermelinda is applying for a loan of 1,000 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of second hand clothes. She started to do this business in 2009 with her own working capital of 300 USD. Ermelinda is earning a good income from selling her second clothes because many people like to buy them and they are cheap and unique compared to new clothes.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: José Orlando

texts.es:
José de 55 años de edad, solamente estudió primer grado, debido a que su mamá fue madre soltera, su padre los abandonó. Su madre era muy pobre y no le alcanzaba el dinero mas que para la comida, pues eran 5 hijos.
 
Él está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de tortillas y lácteos, tienen 3 hijos, 1 ya se acompañó, solo 2 dependen de él que actualmente están estudiando en la escuela.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 18 años, aprendió este trabajo con unos amigos, además un amigo suyo le enseñó a manejar camión, esto le ha servido de mucho pues así se ha ganado el pan de cada día, desde hace 25 años maneja y hace 6 años comenzó con su pareja a vender productos lácteos, la necesidad y el deseo de superación con sus hijos, lo ha llevado a aprender muchos trabajos,  lo hace con toda su disposición pues siempre piensa en su familia. 

Su su día es bastante agitado, pues se levanta a las 4:30 AM ya que a veces las demás personas necesitan sus servicios de motorista y tiene que madrugar. 

Él necesita este crédito, para invertir en la compra de queso, crema y quesillo, pues la demanda de clientes es mas grande y no ha podido cubrir las necesidades de estos. 

Además sueña con tener su propio camión para trabajar, que sus últimos hijos se preparen en una carrera profesional y con la ganancia espera pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
José, 55 years old, was only in school for the first grade due to the fact that his mother was a single parent because his father abandoned them. His mother was very poor and had money only for food since there were five children.

He has a partner and his wife sells torillas and dairy products. They have three children, one of whom has a partner while the other two are currently in school and still dependent on him.

José has been a farmer since he was 18 years old. He learned the work with some friends. In addition another friend taught him how to drive a truck and that has been very handy since that is how he has earned his daily bread. He has driven a truck for 25 years and six years ago he started selling dairy products with his wife. His need and desire to succeed for his children has inspired him to learn many trades and he has performed them all well because he is always thinking of his family.

His day is pretty hectic since he gets up at 4:30 a.m. because at times others need his transport services and he has to get up early.

He needs this loan to order to purchase cheese, cream and quesillo (a cheese based dish) since these items are in higher demand by his customers and he has not been able to meet this demand.

In addition, he dreams of owning his truck for work and that his younger children prepare themselves for professional careers. He expects to pay off the loan from his profits.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, cream and quesillo (a cheese based dish) since he is unable to meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Berta

texts.en: Berta is requesting a loan of 600 USD to improve her business. She is selling petrol and gasoline. She started to sell petrol and gasoline a year ago with her own working capital of 1,200 USD. She is earning a good income from this business. She lives near the main road so many people come to buy her petrol and gasoline.

loans.use: to buy petrol and gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Hulda

texts.en: Hulda is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She makes rings, bangles, and earrings from turtle shells. She started to do this business in 2011 with her own working capital of 200 USD. She will use her loan to buy a knife, turtle shells and other materials. She is happy with the loan that is offered to her.

loans.use: to buy a knife, turtle shells and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is requesting a loan of 600 USD to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. Domingas started to open her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of 300 USD. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent and other things to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Flordeliza has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant, like fish, meat, and vegetables. She successfully paid back her previous loan and has now requested a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Flordeliza would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stablity of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant, like fish, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Francia works hard to support her family. She sells school supplies in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. 

Francia is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items like glue, cartolina (construction paper), and pads of paper to sell in her school supply business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Francia has been sustaining her business activities through NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional school supplies to sell

loans.name: Luisa Alejandra

texts.es:
Luisa de 49 años de edad, solo estudió hasta  sexto grado, debido a que eran de escasos recursos económicos y ella era una de las hijas mayores, entonces tenia que ayudar a sus padres a trabajar, tanto en la casa como en el campo,ella está casada pero su esposo vive en otro lugar, solo los 3 hijos vieven con ella además de su madre.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de tamarindo y carao, pues tiene en su casa algunos árboles de esas frutas y cuando es muy poco lo que obtiene de su cosecha,  le compra a los vecinos. Esta actividad lo aprendió de su madre pues desde niña la llevaban al mercado, antes se dedicaba a otro rubro, ya que junto con su esposo trabajaba en la agricultura, pero debido a que les fue mal en la siembra y obtuvieron pérdidas, su esposo decidió emigrar a los Estados Unidos. 

La venta en el mercado la hace por la mañana y por la tarde regresa a trabajar en los quehaceres de su casa.

Este préstamo le ayudará a Luisa en la construccion de una habitación, ya que su casa es muy pequeña y sus hijos ya son mayores, además construirá un muro al frente de su casa, el dinero que tiene no le es suficiente y con el préstamo terminará de completar lo que le hace falta.

En un futuro, ella sueña con tener una vivienda digna en el cual pueda vivir con sus hijos y nietos y poder darles  el estudio para que sean personas preparadas. Ademas, desea reecontrarse algún día con su esposo, ella está seguro que el crédito le permitirá hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en: Luisa, 49, only went to school through the sixth grade. Economic resources were scarce and she was one of the oldest daughters, so she had to help her parents work in the home as well as in the fields. She is married, but her husband lives elsewhere. Only her three children live with her, in addition to her mother. She works selling tamarind and carao fruits, since she has some of these trees at her house and when she doesn't get much from her harvest, she buys from her neighbors. She learned this work from her mother, because ever since she was little, her mother took her to the market. Previously, she and her husband worked together in agriculture. But because sowing went badly for them and they had losses, her husband decided to emigrate to the United States. She sells in the market in the mornings, and in the afternoons she returns to do the housework. This loan will help Luisa to build a room, since her house is very small and her children are older now. She will also build a wall in front of her house. The money she has is not enough, and with the loan she will have what she needs. In the future, she dreams of having a respectable home where she can live with her children and grandchildren, and provide them with an education so they can be trained. She also wants to reunite with her husband someday. She is sure that the loan will allow her to make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to build a room and also a wall at the front of her house.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three East African countries, allowing cross-border flow of goods and people; a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. 

Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result, school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average. 

Samuel is married and has five children. Both he and his wife are farmers and are currently growing maize, beans and groundnuts on their land. Samuel is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper, as it will provide him with a good income source and also enable his children to eat more honey. 

This is Samuel's first loan on Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to pay school fees for his children. His hope for the future is "to have educated children."

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old and married with four children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, can goods, bread, chips, etc.

Gemma has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from a buy and sell rice business.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, can goods, bread, chips, etc

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 62 años de edad, estudió hasta primer grado, debido a que sus padres no pensaron que podría ser  importante el estudio, está acompañado y su esposa trabaja vendiendo cuajada, tienen 2 hijos que ya están acompañados, nadie mas depende de ellos, pues viven solos en su casa.

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años, con su papá aprendió este trabajo, además le enseñó el trabajo de albañil y le gusta cuidar ganado, ya que en la casa de su padre siempre tuvieron vacas. 
Su rutina diaria comienza a las 4:00 AM para ordeñar las vacas, luego se toma un café y de una vez lleva el ganado al pasto y se queda trabajando en la milpa, debe hacer un largo recorrido de 30 minutos a pie, trabaja aproximadamente 6 horas en el campo y regresa a casa para tomar su almuerzo. 
Por la tarde alimenta el ganado para que le de mas leche, pues es de eso es que obtiene mas ingresos.

Miguel necesita de este crédito, pues espera invertir una parte para comprar otra vaca, y el resto del dinero, para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde pastea su ganado. Con el préstamo cubrirá la necesidad de alquilar el terreno.

Sus sueños son, comprar un terreno para dejarles a sus hijos un lugar donde puedan construir su casa, pues donde viven ahora es ajeno, comprar otras 5 vacas lecheras y llegar a obtener una estabilidad económica, y con la ganancia de la leche, espera poder pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Miguel, 62 years old, finished the first grade because his parents did not think that an education could be important. He has a partner and his wife works selling curd. They have two children and both have partners. No-one is dependent on them and they live alone in their house.

He has been a farmer since he was 12 years old. He learned the work from his father who also taught him bricklaying. He also enjoys caring for cattle since his father always had cows in their home.

His daily routine begins at 4 a.m. when he milks the cows. Then he drinks a cup of coffee and takes all of his cattle to pasture. He remains working in his corn fields. He has to make a long trip on foot of about 30 minutes. He works approximtley six hours in the fields and then returns home for lunch. In the afternoon he feeds the cattle so they will give more milk, since it is from that product that he makes a living.

Miguel needs this loan and hopes to invest part in the purchase of another cow and the rest in the rent on pasture land for his cattle. The loan will also cover the rent for land.

His dreams are to purchase land, so that his children have a place to build their houses since where they live now is remote, and to purchase another five milk cows and thus achieve economic stability. He expects to be able to pay off the loan with the profits from his milk sales.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and pay the rent on a piece of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire workers to assist him in cleaning and under brushing his mature cacao trees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire helpers in assisting him to clean his cacao farm

loans.name: Ziyodajon

texts.en: Ziyodajon was born in 1988. She is married. Ziyodajon lives in a rural area in an old house which was built with the great dedication of her grandfather. Ziyodajon began her own sewing business a year ago. Now her business is going well. From the profits of her business, she, little by little, improved her living conditions. She wants to repair her house but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 1,700 Somoni to buy building materials for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia is 55 years old, married and has three children. 

Ma. Delia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ma. Delia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and a variety of seedlings for her farm.

Ma. Delia has been farming vegetables for ten years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Ma. Delia would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a variety of seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy an additional fish net for her fishing business.

Jenelyn has been in this business for 2 years. She earns more income from a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase materials like wood, paints, bamboo, etc for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Gina has been in this business for 15 years. Gina earns more income from a body massage service.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wood, paints, bamboo, etc for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Helaria

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Helaria works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. Helaria is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to  buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Helaria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: José Wilberto

texts.es:
José de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, porque sus padres siempre lo mandaron solo a trabajar, ya que su situacion económica era muy dificil, vivían en pobreza y necesitaban ingresos económicos para poder subsistir. Él está casado y tiene 2 hijos, su esposa no trabaja pero se dedica al oficio del hogar y su hijo mayor  asiste a la escuela.

José tiene un pickup, con el que hace cualquier tipo de viajes a sus vecinos, también compra y vende chatarra desde hace 15 años, para hacer su trabajo tiene que salir a varias comunidades durante todo el día, para comprar la chatarra que las personas tiene en sus casas, (hierros viejos, latas) y luego viaja a la capital para venderlos en centros de acopio de chatarra mayoristas, se dedica a este negocio por su bajo nivel de estudio y se le hace muy dificil conseguir un buen empleo formal.

Él solicita este crédito, para tener efectivo y poner un centro de acopio para comprar chatarra a personas que venden por cantidades pequeñas. El crédito le ayudará a mejorar su negocio, ya que así las personas le llevarán el producto hasta su lugar de acopio.

José sueña con que su negocio sea mas productivo, de esa manera podra dar el estudio a sus hijos, hasta que logren ser profesionales.
texts.en:
José, age 39, went to school through the ninth grade because his parents always sent him to work.  Their financial situation was very difficult.  They lived in poverty, and they needed income in order to be able to live.

He is married and has two children.  His wife does not work, but she does the household chores.  His oldest child goes to school.

José has a pick-up, which he uses to make any types of trips for his neighbors.  He has also been buying and selling scrap metal for 15 years.  In order to do his work, he has to go to various communities during the entire day.  He does this in order to buy the scrap metal that people have at their houses (old iron, cans).  He then goes to the capital to sell them at the wholesale scrap metal collection centers.  He devotes himself to this business because his low level of education makes it difficult for him to get good, formal employment.

He is requesting this loan in order to have cash and to set up a collection center to buy scrap metal from people who sell in small quantities.  The loan will help him improve his business.  This way the people will bring the product to his center.

José dreams of his business being more productive.  This way he will give his children an education up until they manage to become professionals.

loans.use: to set up a collection center to buy scrap metal.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is 42 years old and engages in a lumber business for the last 4 years. She presently is residing in Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, with 2 children, both in school. She became a member of Paglaum 4 years ago. She has a monthly income in lumber of Php 15,000.00. Recently, she applied for a loan of Php 30,000 to purchase additional 5 pcs of coconut tree, 5 pcs of mahogany tree and 5 pcs of gemilina tree for lumber. The profit of her business is used to pay tuition fees for her children and to pay for her co-op obligations.

loans.use: purchase wood lumber

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 47 years old. She is married and she has two sons. Gayane with her family lives in Vanadzor city in Lori tegion. Her husband and elder son work at the chemical factory; there her husband works as a commandant and her son is mechanic there. Gayane has a higher education and a specialty of teacher, but she has never worked of her specialty. Gayane has her own business. In city wholesale market on a rented stall she sells men and women clothes. She buys her stall merchandise from Yerevan once in a month. She has many loyal customers who constantly visit her stall and they like both Gayane’s stall products and her polite way of service. 
Gayane asks a loan of 300.000 Armenain drams in order to buy new collection of spring season women and men clothes for sale. She needs this loan very much since her husband’s and son’s salaries are not paid already for second month and the only source of income for her family is her clothes trading business.

loans.use: to buy new collection of spring season women's and men's clothing for sale

loans.name: Valentín

texts.es:
Valentín de 63 años de edad,  no tiene muchos años de educación, está casado y tiene 3 hijos que ya no viven con ellos, su esposa no trabaja, solamente se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.

Él se ha dedicado al trabajo de albañil durante toda su vida, su padre le inculcó a que fuera un hombre trabajador, él le ayuda a su esposa pues viven solos. Valentín se levanta desde muy temprano, para salir hacia su trabajo a las 7:00 AM y  regresa a su casa a la 1:00 PM. 

Valentín necesita muchísimo de este préstamo, para construir un muro en su casa antes que inicie la época de invierno, la consturcción de este muro le permitirá que no entre demasiada agua a su vivienda durante las fuertes lluvias. 

Tiene otro negocio de venta de leña, el cual les va bien y también obtienen ingresos extras para cubrir sus necesidades.

Él sueña con seguir trabajando para su esposa y seguir mejorando su vivienda y está seguro que lo logrará con la ayuada de Dios y de esta institución.
texts.en:
Valentín, 63, did not receive many years of education, is married and has three children who no longer live with them. His wife does not work, she only does the housework.

He has made a living as a mason his entire life. His father instilled in him that he should be a hard-working man. He helps his wife since they live alone. Valentín gets up very early to go to work at 7:00 AM, and returns home at 1:00 PM. 

Valentín really needs this loan so he can build a wall in his house before the winter season begins. The construction of this wall will prevent too much water from entering their house during the strong rains.

He has another business selling firewood, which is going well and also helps them obtain extra income to cover their needs. He dreams of continuing to work to support his wife, and continuing to improve their home, and he is sure that he will be able to achieve this with the help of God and this institution.

loans.use: to build a wall in his house

loans.name: Josphert's Group

texts.en:
Josphert has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser in Muyundi village in Vihiga, Kenya. Josphert is a friendly, goal oriented and hardworking member of the community with 6 children. Josphert lives with them in a house made of mud walls, sand floor and grass roof.

Muyundi village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Josphert and the 20 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Josphert has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Josphert volunteered to be the promoter because he is trusted by the community and he wants to help his community prevent diarrhea. There is also another volunteer promoter, Florence, from the surrounding community who is part of this group loan.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Josphert’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Jessica Camila

texts.en: Jessica, 23, is married and lives with her parents and a brother.  She has always loved fashion and always wanted a store. She began saving money when she worked so she could one day achieve her dream. It took one year and she managed to rent a place and invest in the structure. She reformed it and painted it so that the store is now ready to open. But  she has no money to buy the goods and this has made the shop stay closed for three months, generating rental costs. She needs 2,500.00 BRL to buy the clothes, mannequins and some accessories.

loans.use: to buy closes, mannequins and accessories.

loans.name: Unidas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Unidas Por Siempre está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité, todas ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas que con mucho esfuerzo están saliendo adelante por medio de la lucha diario, son de una zona muy carente, y quieren ir mejorando.
Elida misma hace comidas que sale a vender y comenta que ya se ha hecho de clientela fiel que siempre compra de ella sus comidas, además de eso comenta que todos los días ella empieza su trabajo desde temprano para poder hacer comidas frescas y venderlas. Vio una esperanza en el grupo, por lo que decidió unirse.
Pide este préstamo para comprar insumos para sus comidas, como ser carne, condimentos, verduras, aderezos y demás, lo que le será de mucha ayuda para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The “Unidas Por Siempre” group is in its first cycle of the committee.  The members are all striving women who have gotten ahead through their hard work.  They are from a very scarce area and they want to improve.

Elida makes food that she goes out to sell and says that she has loyal customers who always buy her food.  She begins working very early every day so she can make and sell fresh food.  She saw hope in the group and decided to join.

She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients such as meat, condiments, vegetables, seasonings, and other things.  This will help her very much with her work.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 45 years old and married, with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Janeth has a buy-and-sell clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business. Janeth requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. 

She also sells personal beauty products (Avon) as an additional business.

In the future, Janeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 57 years old and married with five children.

Sandra works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sandra has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for three years and earns additional income from food vending.

Sandra aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: José Amilcar

texts.es:
José tiene 70 años de edad, solamente estudió hasta quinto grado, está casado y tiene 7 hijos que ya tienen su propio hogar. Uno de su hijos atiende un negocio de molino y otra hija trabaja haciendo pan, por lo que económicamente solo su esposa depende de él.

El negocio del molino lo tiene desde hace dieciséis años, la idea de este negocio nació, debido a que el señor observó que era rentable, también tiene cuatro años de trabajar con mototaxis, ya que también vio que era un buen negocio, a pesar de ello, José siempre se dedica a la agricultura y sus hijos le ayudan de vez en cuando en el trabajo.

José necesita de este crédito, para comprar algunos muebles para su casa, repara el molino y la mototaxi. 

Además sueña con remodelar su casa en un futuro, pues desea verla en mejores condiciones, y si es posible, comprar más mototaxis para aumentar el servicio que presta a la comunidad donde él reside.
texts.en:
José, age 70, only went to school through the fifth grade.  He is married, and he has seven children.  The children now have their own households.  One of his sons tends a mill business, and a daughter works making bread.  Only his wife is financially dependent upon him.

He has had the mill business for 16 years.  The idea for this business was born because he observed that it was profitable.  Also, he has worked with 'mototaxis’ [three-wheeled motorized vehicles] for four years.  He also saw that this was a good business.

In spite of this, José has always worked in agriculture.  His children help him with his work once in a while.  

José needs this loan to buy some furniture for his house and to repair the mill and the mototaxi.

He also dreams of remodeling his house in the future.  He wishes to see it in better condition.  If possible, he wants to buy more mototaxis in order to increase the service that he provides the community where he lives.

loans.use: to buy some furniture for his house and to repair the mill and the mototaxi.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es: “LAS ESTRELLITAS” es un grupo conformada por personas empeñosas a mejorar la calidad de sus familias. Ellos se encuentran pasando el ciclo 03. Maria tiene 40 años es casada con 02 hijos de 03 años y el otro de  10 meses. Ella se dedica a la venta de gas hace 4 años. Años atrás  se dedicaba a brindar servicios de mantenimiento. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una pequeña carreta para distribuir con más facilidad su producto. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Maria es la tercera persona parada viste polo  de color fucsia.
texts.en: “LAS ESTRELLITAS” is a group made up of people determined to improve the quality of life for their families.  They are in their third cycle.  Maria is 40 years old and has two children, ages 3 and 10 months.  She has been selling gas for the past four years.  Years ago she used to do maintenance work.  She will use the money from this loan to buy a small cart so she can distribute her product.  The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan.  Maria is the third person standing, wearing a fuchsia polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy a delivery cart.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie, 30 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. She's into a food vending business, specifically selling native cakes and bananas in their village. She's been in this business for one year and earns a net income of PHP 300 a day. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to take a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more bananas and more raw ingredients to make native cakes to sell in their village. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve and expand her business to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas and more raw ingredients

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and lives in Mohon, Aloran,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. One of er children is school age and the other one is still an infant. For their means of living, Evelyn has been manages a small carinderia and a beauty parlor business for seven years already and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to purchase 3 sacks of rice, 6 kilos of beef, 6 kilos of meat, 6 kilos of dressed chicken, 5 kilos of fish, spices, seasonings, 10 cases of soft drinks and other ingredients for the food she’s going to sell in her carinderia and hair color, hair dressings, and other accessories for her beauty parlor business as well. 

Evelyn became a member of PMPC just this year.  In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her carinderia and hair care products and accessories for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 53 years old, and is a hog grower living in a peaceful village. She has been in her business for two years now and is hoping for improvement on her hog disposals. Aside from her hog growing business, she also sells vegetables to generate additional income. 

Lucena would like to raise healthy hogs, but has insufficient funds. That is why she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs’ maintenance.

In the future, Lucena hopes to maintain healthy hogs so she could dispose of them at a higher cost.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hog maintenance.

loans.name: Amilcar Antonio

texts.es:
Amilcar de 48 años de edad, solamente estudió primer grado, debido a la situación económica y al conflicto armado su padre , ya no quiso que fuera a la escuela pues tenía miedo a que se lo llevaran los de la guerrilla, por eso dejó la escuela.
 Está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tiene un hijo que ya está acompañado y solo una nieta vive con ellos.


Amilcar se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene 10 años, pues fue su papá quien le enseñó el trabajo, pero desde hace 20 años trabaja como corralero en un establo, fue la necesidad por sostener a su familia la que lo indujo a desempeñar esta actividad. Antes de trabajar en el corral también prestó su servicio militar en el ejército durante 6 años. Su día comienza a las 3:00 AM para ordeñar las vacas, porque hay que entregar la leche a las 7:30 AM, y luego llevar las vacas al potrero donde se queda a trabajar y cuidar el ganado hasta las 1:00 PM, después regresa a su casa para tomar su almuerzo y a las 4:00 PM recoger el ganado para el corral, así es su vida diaria.  
El prestamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar uns ternera ,ya que sueña con tener su propio ganado.
Amilcar sueña poder construir una casa a su hijo, ya que vive en lo ajeno, además sueña con tener unas 10 vacas lecheras. El préstamo le ayudará pues desea comenzar a cumplir sus sueños comprando la ternera. Y con la ganancia espera poder pagar el crédito a la institución.
texts.en:
Amilcar is 48 years old and only has a first grade education. Due to his family's financial situation and because of armed conflict, his father did not want him to go to school because he was afraid the guerrillas would take him. For this reason, he had to quit school.

Amilcar is in a relationship and his partner takes care of the household duties. They have a son who is already in a relationship. The only person living with them is a granddaughter.

Amilcar has been farming since the age of 10 since it was his father who taught him how to work. However, for the past 20 years, he has worked as a handler at a stable out of necessity because he needed to support his family. Prior to working as a farm hand, Amilcar served in the military for six years.

His day begins at 3:00 A.M. since he must milk the cows before the product is delivered at 7:30 A.M. Afterwards, the cows are taken out to pasture and he continues to look after them until 1:00 P.M. He returns home to have lunch before rounding up the cows at 4:00 P.M. This is his daily routine.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a calf since he dreams of having his own cattle. Amilcar would also like to build a house for his son who is living abroad. In addition, he would like to have 10 dairy cows. This loan will help him to start fulfilling those dreams with the purchase of a calf. With his earnings, he expects to repay the loan from CrediCampo.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2009 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. Daisy is a pedicab operator. She has five pedicabs, which are rented by drivers.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000. This loan is intended to purchase construction materials for a house repair. The income from her pedicabs will be used to pay off the loan she requested from PMPC.

Daisy dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house repair

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jocelyn has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling gasoline.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Resureccion

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Resureccion works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store.  Resureccion is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Resureccion has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Juniet Carolina

texts.es: Juniet es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco, casada y madre de un hijo. Tiene 30 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan. Inicio su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo que ya tenía conocimiento del negocio y poco a poco este fue creciendo y aumentando su clientela. Su meta próxima es incrementar la venta de pan y mantener su clientela. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Harina, Aceite, Levadura, Margarina y Leña. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ofrecerles a los clientes diferentes tipos de pan. Su plan futuro es comprar una pasteadora, mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y optimizar las condiciones del local donde realiza el pan.
texts.en: Juniet is from Boaco.  She is married and has a son.  She is 30 years old and is a merchant who makes and sells bread.  She started her business with her husband’s help who already knew the business and she began growing it and increasing her number of customers.  Her next goal is to increase her sales of bread and keep her customers.  She is asking for this loan to buy flour, cooking oil, yeast, butter, and firewood.  She believes that the loan will be of great help and she will be able to offer different types of bread to her customers.  Her future plans are to buy a cake maker, improve her home, and optimize her shop.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the gas cooking package in order to balance between workload and preparing food for the family

loans.name: Cresencio

texts.en:
Cresencio is a jeep driver. He is 42 years old, married with five children and is still in school. His wife is a housekeeper and is responsible for taking care of their children. His main source of income comes from transportation services and he has been doing this for more than three years, earning well for the family. 

He heard about GDMPC a long time ago and recently became interested in joining. He borrowed a micro finance loan to buy new tires to replace the old used ones. He is hoping to expand his services to gain more returns and to be able to provide employment to the community. In the future, he wants to live happily and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn's greatest dream in life is to successfully have her three children finish their studies. According to her, she doesn't have any wealth to leave her children so that’s why she is doing her best just to sustain her children's needs in pursuing their studies. 

Evelyn manages a hog-raising business in their village. In addition, she offers meat in the market as an additional source of income. This time, Evelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 33,000 to buy pigs to butcher and sell in the market. Evelyn hopes to maintain this business, which will serve as her source of income in sustaining her children's needs in school.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher and sell in the market

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Angie has been in this business for three years. Angie earns more income from her general store.

Angie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business and repair her family's home in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Henrylin

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Henrylin works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Henrylin is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy bamboo, binder and other fishing equipment.

Henrylin has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, binder and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Noemi Isabel

texts.es:
Noemi, estudió hasta noveno año de estudios secundarios, su padre murió cuando ella era tan solo una niña. Aprendió a trabajar desde temprana edad. Estuvo casada por un buen tiempo, pero las cosas no resultaron tan bien. Tiene 3 hijos, pero dos de ellos se encuentran en Estados Unidos, actualmente está viviendo en la casa de la suegra de uno de sus hijos, pues ellos (la familia de la suegra) también se encuentran en Norteamérica. En la casa vive también una sobrina con sus hijos y su esposo. Actualmente solo dependen de ella (niña Noemí)  su hijo menor.

Los ingresos que recibe niña Noemi son básicamente las remesas que recibe por parte de sus hijos. Sin embargo, para mantenerse ocupada  se dedica a la elaboración de tamales que los vende casa por casa con ayuda de su hijo menor que es el encargado de cargarlos en su bicicleta.

El préstamo lo necesita, para terminar de pagar un terreno que desde los Estados Unidos  un hijo suyo está pagando a plazos desde hace ya varios años,  ya solo le falta una poca cantidad para que sean totalmente dueños de estos lotes. Este terreno lo están apartando para hacer las casas que les servirán para que vivan tranquilamente como familia.
Ella sueña con ver a toda su familia junta y de esta manera crecer en  armonía y estabilidad, pues ella piensa que es solo unidos es que se puede salir adelante. También desea que sus hijos logren sus metas trazadas y que formen buenos hogares que contribuyan al desarrollo del país.
texts.en:
Noemi completed her secondary education through the ninth grade. Her father died when she was a girl, so she had to learn how to work at an early age. Noemi was married for a long time, but things did not turn out well. She has three children, two of whom are in the United States. Noemi currently lives at the house owned by the mother-in-law of one of her children since that family also lives in North America. Also living with her and her husband is a grand-niece. Her name is also Noemi and she is the only one who is dependent on her.

The money Noemi receives for her grand-niece consists of remittances that are sent from her children. In order to stay busy, Noemi makes tamales and sells them by going door-to-door. Her grand-niece helps her by traveling on her bicycle and taking orders.

The loan she is requesting will be used complete the payments for a plot of land in the United States. Her son has been paying the installments for several years, but he only lacks a small amount before taking complete ownership of the property. This land will be used for building houses so that they all can live peacefully as a family.

Noemi dreams of seeing her entire family together so that they can grow in harmony and stability. She believes that being together is the only way for them to move forward. Noemi also wants her children to achieve their goals, develop good families, and contribute to the development of the country.

loans.use: to finish the payments on a piece of property.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for clean, reliable and readily available cooking energy

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma, married with five children, operates a fishing business to make a living. She vends the fish she catches in their village. She has been in this field of business for five years and she earns a good income to provide for her family. Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Elma wants to own a stall in the market in town where she could vend fish. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.es:
Altagracia tiene 49 años de edad, solamente estudió hasta tercer grado, ahora ella está casada y tiene tres hijos por quienes luchó por darles una buena educación y además adoptaron una niña hace casi 20 años.

Desde hace más de 20 años decidió emprender su propio negocio de una pequeña tienda, de la cual obtienen los ingresos económicos para sobrevivir, para cubrir los gastos y para darles lo necesario a sus hijos en el estudio, uno de ellos se graduó de sacerdote y los demás ya formaron su propio hogar, de los cuales uno vive en los estados unidos y le ayuda en lo que puede.

Altagracia necesita mucho de este crédito para la construcción de una fosa y si le alcanza para medicinas por algún inconveniente que llegara a tener con su salud. 

Ella tiene como objetivo, que sus nietos estudien y tengan la oportunidad de un trabajo digno y formal en el que se sientan a gusto.
texts.en: Altagracia, 49, only went to school until the third grade. Now she is married and has three children. She fought to give them a good education and they also adopted a daughter almost twenty years ago. More than twenty years ago, she decided to start her own business, a small store, from which they get the income to survive, meet expenses, and give their children what they need education-wise. One of them became a priest and the others already live in their own homes. One lives in the United States and helps Altagracia when possible. Altagracia really needs this loan to build a trench and if it is enough, for medicines in case of anything that may happen with her health. Her goal is for her grandchildren to go to school and have the opportunity to have respectable and formal employment that they like.

loans.use: to build a trench

loans.name: Batzaya

texts.en: Batzaya is 25 years old and lives with his wife and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2013, he graduated from university and has worked for six months as an assistant worker at an organization that funds environmental projects. His wife is currently pregnant and stays at home looking after their child. After working at his job, he renders taxi services to local people for extra income. Recently, his family relocated to a small house and before this, he and his wife lived together with his parents. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy a dresser, sofa, and dining table so that his family will live in a comfortable place, which is essential for a child bearing woman. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for his family.

loans.use: to buy a dresser, sofa, and dining table.

loans.name: Marjul

texts.en: Marjul is 26 years old, married with two kids, and a resident of Bunawan, Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She has a rice retail business and generates income for the education needs of her children. Marjul has been a member of PMPC for two years, and enjoys the privilege of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase empty sacks for selling rice. Marjul deeply wishes to maintain a membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase empty sacks for her rice retail business.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en: Carlita is 55 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. To make a living, Carlita is engaged in fish vending. She is earning an approximate amount of 4,500 PHP each month by doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional kilos of fish for resale.
