Carlita has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Carlita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of fish.

loans.name: Venancio

texts.en: Venancio is 49 years old and is from the town of Antequera, Bohol. He is married with five children ages two to nineteen. For thirteen years, he has been farming rice, raising hogs, and selling coconut wine. He is locally called "mananggite" which means that he climbed coconut trees for their tuba (wine) which is consumed by locals like an alcohol or to be fermented and sold as a vinegar. Venancio is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and feed. This will help so he can continue doing his business while supporting his family's needs. In the future, he hopes to be more successful in his business so he can give his children a better future through education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed.

loans.name: Gilberto Antonio

texts.es:
Gilberto tiene 67 años de edad, por circunstancias de la vida no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, actualmente está casado y  su esposa es comerciante, tiene un hijo que está estudiando, solamente dos personas dependen de él.

La actividad a la que él se dedica es como vendedor ambulante de minutas, teniendo una experiencia de 20 años dedicándose a esta actividad, este negocio lo aprendió por sí solo, pues la necesidad de salir adelante lo llevó a trabajar en lo primero que le fuera posible, además de eso, también vende panes en todo el pueblo donde él reside.

Debido al tipo de trabajo que Gilberto realiza, necesita bastante de este crédito para comprar un carretón nuevo, pues el que tiene ahora se encuentra en mal estado, de ello depende que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo obteniendo ingresos para él y su familia.

Entre sus objetivos para futuro están, que su negocio crezca y en cuanto sea posible, montar un local fijo, además desea que su hijo se involucre en el negocio, ya que necesitará de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Gilberto, 67, was not able to attend school, due to his life circumstances.  He is now married, and his wife is a merchant.  He has a son who is in school, and only these two people depend on him.

Gilberto has a business selling shaved ice on the street.  He's been doing this work for 20 years.  He learned this trade on his own, as the need to earn money led him to start working as early as possible.  In addition to this business he also works selling bread all around the town where he lives.

Because of the type of work that Gilberto does, he needs this loan to buy a new cart, because the one that he has is in bad condition.  He depends on this equipment in order to continue forward with his work so that he can earn income for himself and his family.

Among his goals for the future are: growing his business as much as possible, obtaining a fixed location for his business, and involving his son in his business, because he will really need his help.

loans.use: to buy a new cart

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 58 years old and lives in Carmen, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Elvira is presently employed in the local government unit of her municipality and receives approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos each month for this type of work. She also earns a little income from their parcel of coco land. 

She has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house repair and expansion. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost two years. In the future, she hopes to engage in business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repair and expansion

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married and has two adult-aged children. Grace owns and operates a farm, raising crops to earn a living. For many years in farming, she has provided for her family's needs and was able to send her children to school. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying fertilizer. She has been a GDMPC member since 2009 and she has gained access to micro finance services of the cooperative. Recently, she took out a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and to pay for coconut replanting costs. Improving their farm is her plan because it is their main source of income and she wants to ensure a better living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and pay for coconut replanting costs

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 48 years old and lives in Macabayao Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Yolanda has been engaged in operating an internet café business for five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing parts and accessories for her computer unit repairs and maintenance. Yolanda has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase parts and accessories.

loans.name: Julesa

texts.en: Julesa lives in Misamis Occidental with her three children. She runs a general store selling goods in their local community to earn a living and has been in this business for five years. She had many competitors in the area but she had her loyal customers who visited her store and make some purchases.  She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy additional grocery goods to sell. Julesa planned to expand her store in order to gain more income for the family needs.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en: Jelyn, a mother of five children, helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living. For five years, the couple has earned enough to provide for the family. Growing and harvesting banana is now their main source of income. Jelyn had planned to improve their farm in order to send her children to school. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC to cover the costs for banana replanting and weeding maintenance. In the future, Jelyn wants to provide good education to her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to cover the costs for banana replanting and weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a frozen foods retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from general store and food vending businesses. Jean is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell for her frozen foods business.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: María Alejandra

texts.es:
Maria de 37 años de edad, lastimosamente no estudió ningun grado en la escuela, ya que se crió con una tía y por no ser hija propia, no le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar, solo tuvo que trabajar muy duro desde pequeña para ganarse la comida. Ahora está casada y tiene 3 hijos, solo 2 viven con ella que actualmente están estudiando y su hijo mayor vive en otra ciudad. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en los cañales y es así como le ayuda económicamente a María.

Actualmente, ella se dedica a vender frutas y verduras, actividad que ha desempeñado desde que era niña, ya que en aquel tiempo tenía que hacer todo lo posible para trabajar en algo y  esto le está sirviendo ahora para sostener a su familia. 

María se levanta desde muy temprano para salir a comprar al mercado, seguidamente tiene que trasladarse a pie a los cantones aledaños para vender, hora  de salida no tiene ya que regresa a su casa a atender a sus hijos hasta que termina toda la mercaderia, en ocasiones la acompaña su hija cuando no va a la escuela.

Ella solicita este crédito, para la construcción de una habitación, ya que su casa es muy pequeña, además quiere invertir en el negocio, pues quiere pagar a alguien para que le ayude.

Sus sueños son, tener una vivienda digna en el cual pueda habitar con sus hijos y nietos, y poder darles  el estudio, pues lamentablemente ella no tuvo esta oportunidad, ademas desea tener un puesto en el mercado para no tener que caminar demasiado, confia en Dios, que este crédito le ayudará a salir adelante, es un mayor esfuerzo pero solo así obtendrá mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
María, 37, didn't go to school at all, regrettably.  She was raised by an aunt and not given the opportunity to go to school because she wasn't her aunt's own child.  She only worked very hard from a young age to get her food.  Now she's married and has three children.  Two of them live with her and attend school; her oldest son lives in another city.  Her husband works in the canals and helps María economically.

Currently María makes a living selling fruits and vegetables, work she has done since she was a little girl.  Back then she had to do everything she could to work at something, and now this is helping her support her family.

María gets up very early to go to the market and shop.  Then she has to walk to the nearby cantons to sell her products.  She doesn't stop working, because she doesn't go home to take care of her children until she sells all her merchandise.  Sometimes María's daughter goes with her if she doesn't go to school.

María's requesting this loan to build a room, because her house is very small.  She also wants to invest in her business by paying someone to help her.

Her dreams are to have a decent house to live in with her children and grandchildren, and be able to give them an education, something she, unfortunately, wasn't able to have.  She also wants to get a stall in the market so she won't have to walk so much.

María trusts in God that this loan will help her get ahead.  It's a big effort, but the only way she'll have a better financial situation.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Jubie

texts.en:
Jubie is 39 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

For the family's means of living, Jubie manages a sari-sari (a retail business) and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos each month doing this type of work. 

Jubie has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. She became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative just this year.

 In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and other consumable products to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
A USD 600 loan is offered to Francisca to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko, Coca-Cola, noodles, water and cigarettes. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Francisca independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko, Coca-Cola, noodles, water and cigarettes

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe YEREDON  est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de ZANGUENA  commune de GUEGNEKA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de savon, et d’habillement. Les femmes du groupe YEREDON sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. La cliente FATOUMATA  la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’habit  d’enfant. Elle compte acheter 14 complets chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 12 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Yeredo group is composed of married women averaging 40 years of age, with three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Zanguena, Guegneka community, Diola prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative district of Mali).

They know each other as relatives neighbors and friends. They sell cooked dishes, soap and clothing. The group members are on their sixth solidarity loan. With the goal of meeting huge customer demand, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso. Our client Fatoumata, the second person from the left in the photo, did not attend school. She currently works as a vendor selling children's clothing. She plans to buy 14 outfits from wholesalers at the weekly market. She sells to a mixed clientele, for cash, out of her home and sometimes as a street vendor. She plans to earn a monthly revenue of 12,000 West African francs, which will be used to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 53 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with three children who are now adults. 

For her means of living, Nancy is engaged in managing a boarding house business. She earns approximately PHP 1,800 each month from this business. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for her boarding house repairs and renovations. 

Nancy has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Nancy hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her boarding house repairs and renovations

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 45 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casada y tiene cinco hijos, tres viven con ella, dos de sus hijos trabajan y uno se encuentra estudiando.

El trabajo en panadería, ha sido la actividad a la cual ella se ha dedicado desde hace 2 años, también trabaja en la crianza de pollos de engorde. 
El trabajo de la panadería lo aprendió gracias a su mamá, el negocio lo tiene en su casa  en el cual se involucran dos hijos y sus esposas. Lidia hace pan todos los días y trabaja de 12:00 del mediodía a 3:00 de la tarde.

El crédito que está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo utilizará para hacer un horno artesanal y ampliar su negocio, de esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida ya que tendrá más ingresos de su panadería.

Lidia sueña con que el negocio crezca, vender sus productos en toda la comunidad, y además servirá para que sus hijos sigan la tradición familiar de la panadería en un futuro.
texts.en:
Lidia is 45 years old, studied till the sixth grade and is married and has five children. Three of them live with her, two of them work and one goes to school. 

She works in a bakery where she has worked for the past 2 years, she also raises chickens.
She learned this business from her mom. The bakery is located in her home and involves her two children and their wives. Lidia makes bread every day and works from 12:00 noon to 3:00 pm. 

The loan she is requesting is to make an artisan-style oven to expand her business.  This will improve their quality of life as they will have more income from the bakery. 

Lidia's dream is to grow the business, to sell her products throughout the community, and to keep her children in the family business for the future.

loans.use: to build a artisan-style oven

loans.name: Fritzie

texts.en:
Christian Jay is 19 years old and is first of four children in the family. His mother Fritzie supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Christian Jay is studying for the degree Bachelor of Science in Business Management. He is currently in the second year of this two-year-and-one-month course.

Christian Jay is borrowing 7,000 PHP to pay the tuition fees of the second semester of the school year 2013-2014.

When he graduates, Christian Jay plans to finish his studies and get a job of his own.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Ma.theresa

texts.en:
Lois Wayne is 16 years old and is the second of two children in the family. Her mother Maria Theresa supports the family through her ready-to-wear clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Lois Wayne is studying for the degree Bachelor of Library and Information Science. She is currently in the first year of this three-and-a-half-year course.

Lois Wayne is borrowing 23,000 PHP to pay the tuition fees of the second semester of the school year 2013-14.

When she graduates, Lois Wayne plans to get a job of her own.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is married with five children. Emeliana is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Emeliana is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to buy four sacks of feed and three piglets. 

Emeliana has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Emeliana hopes to be a meat supplier in different departments and grocery stores.

loans.use: To buy four sacks of feed and three piglets

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Srun, age 36, is a resident from Chhuk Sa village where she lives with her family and operates a farming business. Every day she takes care of the household, kids and crops to ensure that they are in good condition. She cultivates rice as her main crop. Having been in this field for more than 15 years, she is able to generate a daily income of KHR 20,000.

Srun is asking for a loan to buy a used motorcycle to fulfill her family’s transportation needs. Before gaining access to this loan, her family hasn't had a motorcycle, and they often experience difficulties in their transportation and expense for taking private services. With this loan, Srun can prevent her family members from paying for daily taxi service and save more for future business and emergency needs. She is very thankful in advance to all lenders.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to fulfill her family’s transportation needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay some outstanding debts and also to expand the tortilla shop

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married with seven children. Marites is 40 years old and lives in Dumalinao, Philippines.

Marites is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan to buy three sacks of fertilizer for her farm. 

Marites has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Marites hopes to still be a corn supplier in their town.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, 42 years of age, is married to a carpenter and blessed with six children. She's into food market sales, specifically frozen foods, which she has been selling for almost five years. This earns her a net income of PHP 1,000 weekly. Her net profits are usually spent on the family's food expenses. 

Due to lack of capital to run her business, she would like to receive a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase frozen foods to sell such as cured sausages, hotdogs, and cured pork. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve her business in order to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase frozen foods to sell such as cured sausages, hotdogs, and cured pork.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is 56 years, resides in la Esperanza, Rizal. He is married with three children, who are studying in college.  He has engaged in a sari-sari store business for 10 years. His typical net income is PHP 5,000. He is also engaged in farming as another source of income.  

He has applied the amount of PHP 45,000 to purchase additional inventory including basic commodities for his sari-sari store. The profit from the sari-sari store is used in supporting the studies of his three children.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory including basic commodities for his sari-sari store

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is 50 years old and lives in Macasing, Pagadian City. She is married with two children.
 
To earn a living , Emeliana has a carinderia (eatery) business. She earns about 15,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Emeliana has requested a loan to buy kitchen utensils for her carinderia. 

Emeliana has been a member of PMPC for three years. Emeliana would like to to have her own full restaurant someday.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils for her carinderia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy keyboards, bulbs, and camera lenses.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and has six children. Jocelyn is married and two of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to afford to sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns income from farming rice herself. Josefina is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a vehicle

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 53 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like rice, eggs, shampoo, soap, chips, bread and other items.

Josie has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years. She also earns an income from charcoal retailing and food processing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like rice, eggs, shampoo, soap, chips, bread and more.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Judith works hard to support her family.

Judith has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fish vending. She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Houn is 52 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in Krouch, a village in the region of Prey Chhor, Kampong Cham. Her husband helps her with her everyday farming activities and taking care of the household. Houn primarily grows and sells rice in her region, earning on average USD 5.00 per day. She has been a farmer for over 20 years.

As the area she lives is located in a low part of the land, which suffers by water in the rainy season, she is requesting this loan to buy excavated dirt to refill the ground a bit higher than the water level. In this way, she will be better able to avoid flooding. She is very delighted and grateful for the loan support.

loans.use: to buy excavated dirt to refill the ground a bit higher than the water level.

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Lalyn has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Daniel De Jesús

texts.es:
Daniel de 45 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, actualmente está casado y su pareja se dedica al trabajo doméstico, tiene 5 hijos que viven con ellos y todos se dedican todos al trabajo de la agricultura.

 Daniel es albañil desde hace 10 años, pues su cuñado lo llevaba como aprendiz a su trabajo y fue así como aprendió esta actividad, además en la época de siembra, cultiva una hectárea de maíz y una de maicillo, sus hijos le ayudan involucrándose en el trabajo. Para llegar al lugar donde cultiva, debe trasladarse en bicicleta ya que está a 30 metros de su casa.

Él necesita de este préstamo, porque desea construir su casa con paredes de adobe, ya que su vivienda es muy pobre pues está hecha de pedasos de lámina y bolsas plásticas y con el resto del dinero desea comprar insumos para sembrar con regadío.

Los sueños de Daniel son, tener una casa más segura y digna, además quiere construirles una humilde casa a sus hijos, ya que el terreno donde residen es propio y es grande.
texts.en:
Daniel, who is 45 years old, went to school through the sixth grade. He is now married and his wife does domestic work. He has 5 children who live with them, and all of them do agricultural work.

Daniel has been a mason for 10 years, since his brother-in-law took him on as an apprentice in his work, and it was thus that he learned this trade. In addition, during the growing season, he cultivates a hectare of corn and one of sorghum. His children help him, getting involved in the work. To get to the land that he cultivates, he needs to go by bicycle, since it is 30 minutes from his house.

He needs this loan because he wants to build his house with adobe walls, because his home is very poor, since it is made with pieces of metal sheeting and plastic bags, and with the rest of the money he wants to buy supplies to plant with irrigation.

Daniel's dreams are to have a more secure and worthy home. In addition, he wants to build a simple home for his children, since the plot of land where they live is his own and is big.

loans.use: to build his house with adobe walls

loans.name: Milton Alexander

texts.es:
Milton tiene 35 años de edad, está acompañado y solo estudió hasta educación media, únicamente tiene un hijo.

Él se levanta a las 5:00 AM Junto a su compañera de vida e hijo que le apoyan en la actividades agricolas y en el ordeño de las vacas que poseen, ya que dependen económicamente de las actividades que él realiza. 

Milton siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres;  para llegar a la parcelas debe caminar 5  Km y trabaja durante la mañana, su esposa se dedica además a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas que poseen, por las tardes el señor Milton trabaja como motorista.

Él solicita estc préstamo a CrediCampo, para comprar dos vacas, pues las necesita para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener mejores ingresos 

Sus planes a futuro son que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de leche, comprar más vacas que necesita; y también sueña con construir en un futuro una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Milton is 35 years old, has a partner, and only studied until intermediate. He only has one child. 

He gets up at 5:00am together with his partner and son, who help him with the farm work and looking after the cows since they are economically dependent on him.

Milton has always made a living from agriculture, since he learnt it from his parents. In order to get to his parcels of land he has to walk five kilometres. He works during the morning. His wife also does the housework and looks after the cows they own. In the afternoons Milton works as a driver.

He is requesting this loan from CrediCampo so he can purchase two cows, since he needs them in order to increase his milk production so he can sell more milk and obtain more revenue.

His future plans are to buy more cows that he needs with the money he obtains from selling milk, and he also dreams of building a decent home for his family.

loans.use: to buy two cows so he can increase his milk production and obtain more revenue

loans.name: Ysmael Antonio

texts.es:
Ysmael tiene 70 años de edad, es una persona casada y solamente estudió hasta sexto grado.

El señor se levanta a las 5:00 AM junto con su esposa quien le apoya en la actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de las vacas.Él siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres;  para llegar a la parcela, debe caminar 5  km, trabaja durante la mañana, además su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde se dedican a cuidar las vacas que poseen.

Ysmael necesita de este crédito, para comprar cuatro novillas que en futuro le ayudarán a incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener mejores ingresos 

Él planea en un furuto, comprar mas novillas con los ingresos que obtenga de la venta de leche, además desea comprar un terreno para sembrar y tener sus animales.
texts.en:
Ysmael is 70 years old, married and only studied until the sixth grade. He gets up at 5:00 AM with his wife who helps him with the farm work and milking the cows. He has always worked in agriculture which is a business he learned from his parents. To get to the farm, he has to walk five kilometers. He works in the morning. His wife also takes care of the domestic tasks and spends the afternoon caring for their cows. 

Ysmael needs this loan to buy four heifers [young cows] that will help him to increase his future milk production which he can then sell and make more revenue. In the future, he is planning to buy more heifers with the revenue obtained from milk sales. He also hopes to buy a plot of land to sow and to keep his animals.

loans.use: to buy four heifers.

loans.name: José Mauricio

texts.es:
José tiene 24 años de edad, está acompañado y solamente estudió hasta educación media.

 José se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres; se levanta a las 5:00 AM y su esposa lo apoya en la actividades agrícolas, para llegar a la parcela debe caminar 2 km y trabajan durante la mañana y por la tarde trabaja en una gasolinera.

Él está solicitando este préstamo a CrediCampo, para comprar una yunta de bueyes para arar la tierra donde cultiva y podrá obtener un ingreso adicional por arar otras parcelas lo que le ayudará a mantener a su familia.

Entre sus propósitos está comprar un terreno para tener una vivienda digna, esto lo puede lograr con los ingresos que obtiene de venta de leche, de la siembra y el préstamo también le servirá de mucho.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old, lives with his partner, and only went as far as high school.

José is a farmer, an occupation he learned from his parents. He gets up at 5:00 a.m., and has to walk 2 km to get to the plot of land. His wife helps with the farm activities and they work during the morning. In the afternoon he works at a gas station.  

He is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to buy a team of oxen for plowing the land where he farms. He will be able to obtain additional income from plowing other land parcels, which will help him support his family.

One of his goals is to buy a piece of land so that he can have a decent house. He can accomplish this with the income he gets from selling milk and from farming. The loan will also be a big help.

loans.use: To buy a team of oxen to plow the land where he farms.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 38 years old, married and had three children. She manages a store wherein she offers grocery items to the people in her village. Her spouse is a farmer. According to her, her generated income goes for meals, bills at home and education expenses. She hopes to increase her income; that is why she is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy soft drinks, eggs, sardines and biscuits to sell. Some of the amount will also be used in buying hog feed and medicines for her hogs. 

Marilyn hopes to increase her sales capacity and become successful in her businesses for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, sardines and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Lamdaria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lamdaria works hard to support her family.

She is a fish pond operator as a business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Lamdaria is borrowing 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds for her fish in her fish pond.

Lamdaria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tiles and wood for the construction of his house.

loans.name: Lara Bernette

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lara Bernette works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Lara Bernette is borrowing 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase new fishing net for her fishing business.

Lara Bernette has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing net

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. Merlinda is married and has a rug-making business in the Philippines.

Merlinda requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, etc. for her business.

Merlinda has been in this business for three years now.

Merlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric for her business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 63 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her business.

Lilia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is a 46-year-old married woman from the municipality of Antequera, Bohol. She has nine children to support. Her eldest is 26 and her youngest is 4 years old. Alberta has been raising hogs for 20 years now, earning 8,000 PHP per month. She also makes bangles and fancy jewelry for additional income. While her husband is into farming, she is still struggling to provide everything for her family. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy feed to keep her pigs healthy.

She knows that the availability of feed will free her from the worries of buying on a per kilo basis.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and to have other business options.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Percelinda

texts.en:
Percelinda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Percelinda is 57 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Percelinda has a business selling souvenir items in the Philippines. Percelinda requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy more souvenirs to sell.

Percelinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Percelinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more souvenirs to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 43 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lina has been farming rice for four years and earns additional income from her buy and sell of dried fish business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marison

texts.en:
Marison is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marison is 35 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Marison has a buying and selling of purchase order cards business in the Philippines. Marison requested a 21,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more cards to sell to her customers.

Marison has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marison would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more cards to sell to her customers

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 24 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Leah is borrowing 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Leah has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from pig fattening and buying and selling gasoline.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mkombozi Mwenge Group

texts.en:
Steven is a businessman who makes his family living by managing a barbershop. He has been in this business for six years now. His shop is open from 8 am to 10 pm each working day. Steven is able to make a fair monthly profit. He is a man in his early 30s and, with his wife, forms a family with two school kids. 

Steven is a member of Mkombozi Mwenge group, which includes eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Steven is requesting his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy salon materials like oil, cotton and other equipment. With the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, he bought hair-cutting machines and other salon equipment. He managed to receive extra income, which he used to cover school fees and home food expenses. Steven appreciates your loan support for his business.

loans.use: to buy oil, cotton and other salon equipment.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is a retail store owner living in Enrile. She operates her store daily from 6 o'clock in the morning until 6 o'clock in the evening. Melinda sells grocery items, and she's willing to serve her customers properly. To make her goal realistic, she asks for a loan of 35,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy soft drinks, eggs, breads and school supplies to sell. From her loan, she hopes to keep improving her income and someday offer more products.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, breads and school supplies to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a bag-making business in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her bag-making business.

Victoria has been in this business for 11 years now.

Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her bag-making business

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ma. Teresa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Ma. Teresa is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Ma. Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 56 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elenita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Elenita has been raising pigs for three years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: María De La Paz

texts.es:
María tiene 52 años de edad, solamente estudió hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos que ya tienen sus propios hogares, por lo tanto solo vive con su pareja.

Ella se dedica al trabajo doméstico pero también se dedica a la agricultura con su pareja, además cuando pollos cuando regresa del campo, desde muy pequeña su papá le enseñó el trabajo en la agricultura, ya que la familia estaba conformada solo de mujeres y ellas apoyaban al papá. 
A María le sirvió de mucho ya que ahora le ayuda a su esposo, pues están solos porque sus hijos se casaron, pero ellos se sienten felices de trabajar en al campo.  La señora quiere dedicarse por completo a la compra de pollos y cuidarlos ya que es una fuente de ingresos que puede obtener al venderlos cuando crezcan, y de esta manera ayudarle a su pareja a mantener el hogar. 

Con el préstamo solicitado, le ayudará al esposo a sacar los cultivos, y con lo demás  comprará más pollos e intentará hacer una granja más grande para tenerlos ahí. El préstamo mejorara mucho en su vida ya que aparte de sacar las cosechas del campo y tenerlas en casa, también tendrá la oportunidad de tener su granja en un futuro. 

Los planes a futuro de María son seguir trabajando en la agricultura, y si Dios le permite, tener una vejez con bienestar para seguir trabajando y en un futuro tener una granja con muchos pollos y cuidarlos para que le genere ingresos
texts.en: Maria is 52 years old, and only went to school as far as the fourth grade.  She lives in a common-law relationship, and her husband works in agriculture.  She has 3 children who all now have their own homes, and now lives only with her partner.  She works at domestic chores, but also works in agriculture with her husband.  She also takes care of the chickens when she returns from the fields.  Her father taught her agriculture from a very young age.  She now wants to devote herself full-time to buying and raising chickens, because it is a source of income that she can obtain when she sells them, and in this way can help her husband to support the household.  With the loan requested she will help her husband to harvest the crops, and with the rest she will buy more chickens, and try to have a bigger farm to keep them on.  The loan will improve her life greatly, because in addition to bringing in harvest and storing them in the house, she will have the opportunity to have her own farm in the future. Maria's future plans are to continue working in agriculture, and, God willing, to live in comfort on her own farm with many chickens to care for so that they will provide her with income.

loans.use: to harvest the crops, and to buy more chickens,

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susan is 41 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Susan has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Susan requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc., for her business.

Susan has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc., for her business

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 43 years old and single.

Nelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nelia has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, cooking oil and snack foods. 

In the future, Nelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 49 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 32 years old, married and has a kid who is in school.

Eden is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Eden requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Eden has been farming rice for two years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Eden would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
Liwayway is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Liwayway has been in this business for 30 years. 

Liwayway has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru:
Зафар добродушный  мужчина в возрасте 45 лет. Он женат  и имеет четверых детей. Его старшие дети уже взрослые и имеют свои семьи, с ним живёт младшая дочка, которую тоже скоро хотят выдать замуж. Зафар живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Он полон сил и желания работать на благо своей семьи. Зафар  занимается деканством и животноводством. У него имеется  земельная площадь, которая  составляет около 12 га. Из общей площади земли  8 га составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли.  На этой земле  Зафар занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот.  Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход. Также у Зафара есть дополнительная работа, он водитель такси, для этого у него имеется собственный автомобиль.

Скоро Зафар собирается выдавать свою младшую дочь замуж. Это событие очень важное в их жизни и к нему нужно хорошо подготовиться. Для этого Зафар подготавливает приданное для своей дочки. Но сейчас у него не хватает денежных средств для того, чтобы полностью закупить все необходимые вещи для свадьбы дочери. Поэтому Зафар обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку свадебного приданного для своей дочери. Зафар заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Zafar is a kind 45-year-old man who is married and has 4 kids.  He and his family live in a small house in a rural village.  He's hale, hearty and works hard to provide for his family.  He grows crops and raises cattle for a living.  He has a 12-hectare plot of land; 8 hectares don't have irrigation systems, while the other 4 do.  He grows carrots, potatoes and grain crops on his land, and his wife helps him tend the cattle.  As their plot of land is large, they graze their cattle on it as well. His cattle business brings in a good amount of money.  Zafar also earns money on the side as a taxi driver; a trade he plies with his very own car.
    
His oldest kids are already adults and have their own families, while his youngest daughter still lives with him.  Zafar hopes to see her married soon, just as her brothers and sisters are.  It's a very important event not only for her, but for the whole family as well, and it takes a lot of careful preparation.  He wants to provide a dowry for her wedding, but doesn't have enough money to buy everything necessary to do so.  For this reason, he's turned to Arvand for a loan to pay for his daughter's wedding dowry, and would like to thank them in advance for their support.

loans.use: pay for his daughter's wedding dowry

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru: Оксане 34 года, замужем, не смотря на свой молодой возраст она вместе с супругом воспитывают уже 5 детей. У Оксаны - среднее образование, в 1996 году Оксана окончила школу и в этот же год вышла замуж за Нарбека. Вместе они стали заниматься животноводством, купив скот на 16,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Оксаны, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 3 теленка, 1 жеребенок. По хозяйству Оксане помогают супруг и ее дети.  Скот в зимнее время содержится в доме, так как, у Оксаны имеется утепленный хороший сарай для содержания скота, а в летнее время скот отправляют на выпас чабану на пастбище. Корм для скота Оксана со своей семьей заготавливают сами на собственной земельной доле размером 0,64 ГА, сажают клевер. Остальные корма закупают. Ежемесячный доход от реализации молока составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Оксана обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку  бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Оксана планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Oksana is 34 years old and married.  In spite of her young age, she is already the mother of five children, whom she raises with her husband, named Nabrek. She has a secondary education.  She graduated from high school in 1996 and got married the same year. Oksana and Nabrek got involved in animal husbandry together, after buying their first livestock for 16,000 som (KGS).  After years of hard work, Oksana now owns five dairy cows, three calves and one foal.  Her husband and children help her around the farm.  In the winter, Oksana keeps her livestock on the farm where she has a heated barn.  In the summer she sends her livestock to graze in the pastures, with a shepherd.  Oksana and her family own 0.64 hectare of land on which they grow clover to feed their animals.  They also buy additional fodder.  Every month they make 16,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk.

Eager to further develop her farming business, Oksana has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan.  She will use her loan to buy some young bulls and increase her cattle headcount.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings form her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.  She is also planning to save enough money to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy some young bulls.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.fr: marie louise est une femme de 39 ans, marié et mère de 3 enfants. elle possède et gère un restaurant où elle commercialise les repas et des boissons hygiéniques depuis 4 ans dans un quartier de la ville. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières pour la restauration et son stock de marchandises pour la boisson en achetant des jus, bières et eaux pour une valeur de 300 000 afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son activité et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Marie Louise is a 39-year-old woman who is a married mother of three. She owns and manages a restaurant where she has been selling meals and bottled drinks for four years in a district in the city. She is requesting this loan to bolster her stock of ingredients for her restaurant and her stock of merchandise, including juice drinks, beers, and water with a value of 300,000 francs, so as to satisfy her growing customer base and to increase sales. The profits generated are going to be reinvested in her business and used to meet family needs.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: José Félix

texts.es:
José tiene 41 años edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se encuentra en estado de embarazo. En la casa vive también su madre, la cual depende de él.

José tiene 18 años de dedicarse a realizar viajes, él posee un carro con el cual lo contratan para transportar pasajeros a diferentes lugares, la mayoría de las veces es para la ciudad,  que se encuentra aproximadamente a 30 minutos en carro. A José lo buscan mucho sus clientes para realizar este trabajo, pues él es bien cuidadoso y precavido a la hora de manejar.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para reparar  el motor de su carro y parte de la carrocería, pues necesita que su carro esté en perfectas condiciones para continuar su trabajo haciendo viajes y más ahora que está esperando un hijo con su esposa, necesita ingresos económicos para su familia.
 
José sueña con tener un carro en mejores condiciones y de esta manera seguir realizando su trabajo a gusto y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose is 41 years old, studied up until high school, is in a couple and his partner is pregnant. His mother also lives in his home and she depends on him. For 18 years he has used his car to transport passengers to different places, mostly to the city which is approximately a 30 minute drive away. Jose is highly sought after by his customers, because he is a careful and cautious driver. The loan that he's requesting is to repair his car's motor and part of the body, since he needs his car to be in perfect condition to continue making trips for his job. Now that his wife is pregnant he needs income for his family even more. Jose dreams of having a car in better condition so he can continue working comfortably and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To repair his car's motor and part of the body

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur is living in the Baku region with his family. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli city, which was occupied by Armenians 21 years ago. Teymur was married and has a child. His child is three years old. Teymur rents a store where he sells daily food products. Today he wants to buy a refrigerator. For this reason, Teymur needs 1500 Azerbaijan New Manat. He says he is very thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Les Séraphins Group

texts.fr: Bashengezi est un commerçant, président et membre du  groupe d’affaires «Les Séraphins» entrepreneur, dynamique, âgé de 26 ans célibataire. Le client est vendeur de divers articles et sociétaire d’une boutique. Il installe sa marchandise dans un magasin dans le centre  ville. Il commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de  ses parents. Plus tard, il bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 3 ans, qu’il exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 20 litres huiles, 1carton de jus, 1 carton de lotions, 1 sac de sucres, 10 boites de lait, 1 sac de farine formant, les allumettes, de savons de toilette, du sucre, des bonbons, biscuits, sel iodé, de produits cosmétiques, des cahiers, boites de stylos etc. Ainsi, il souhaite accroitre son entreprise et préparer mieux son avenir. En définitif, il remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des hommes et femmes entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Bashengezi is a merchant and the president of the business group "Les Séraphins". An energetic entrepreneur, he is 26 years old and unmarried. This client is a vendor of a variety of items and is a shop associate. He sets up his merchandise in a store downtown. He started his business with initial capital from his parents. Later on, he benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. He has been in this business for three years.

This new loan will be used to purchase 20 liters of oil, a box of juice drinks, a box of lotions, a sack of sugar, 10 boxes of milk, a sack of wheat flour, matches, bath soaps, sugar, candies, cookies, iodized salt, cosmetics, notebooks, boxes of ink pens, etc. He would thus like to grow his enterprise and make a better future for himself. 

In conclusion, he thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among men and women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, especially during this difficult time post-conflict in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase oil, juice drinks, lotions, sugar, milk, flour, matches, soaps, candies, cookies, salt, cosmetics, notebooks, etc.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad is 53, married to a farmer and blessed with two children. She's been a vegetable vendor in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her daily profits usually are spent on purchasing hog feed to supplement the needs of her hogs so that she can generate additional income. Due to insufficient funds for her vegetable vending business, she would like a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase vegetables to sell such as squash, bottle gourd, eggplant, cabbage, and tomatoes. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Les Séraphins 5 Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nabintu est une commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «Les Séraphins 5», senior entrepreneur, âgée de 48 ans et mère de 10 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est couturière et vendeuse de divers habillements. Elle étale sa marchandise dans une maison sur la rue dans une avenue aminée de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est agent dans une agence de sécurité de la place. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 2 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 50 pièces de pagnes et autres divers habits. Ainsi, elle souhaite  accroitre son entreprise, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues de système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile  post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Nabintu, is a merchant and a member of the business group "Les Séraphins 5". She is a senior entrepreneur, 48 years old, and a mother of ten children, who are all students. This client is a seamstress and vendor of a variety of clothing. She displays her merchandise in a house on a busy street in town. She started her business with initial capital from her husband, who is a guard at a local security agency. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for two years. 

This new loan will be used to purchase 50 lengths of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and various clothing. She would thus like to grow her enterprise and provide education and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, especially during this difficult time post-conflict in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase 50 lengths of 'pagne' cloth and various clothing

loans.name: Pacifica

texts.en:
Pacifica is 55 years old, married and the mother of four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Pacifica has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like clothing, bags and school supplies.

Pacifica has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Pacifica would like to save money to expand her business and support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like clothing, bags and school supplies.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 25-year-old very hardworking gentleman. He is married to Sharon and the father of two children who are five and two years old. He has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the last nine years with a monthly income of about KES 27,000.  He learned about VisionFund Kenya from some of his colleagues who are funded by the organization.

Peter has acquired his first loan of KES 30,000, which will enable him in modify his motorbike for the transport business. He is likely to earn more due to the increased mode of this transport in the area. Peter plans to use the proceeds to repay his loan as well as boost his savings account. 

He hopes to buy another motorcycle from his accumulated savings. He is an industrious gentleman who is determined to achieve his goal and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to modify his motorbike for his transport business

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.es: María tiene 60 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo y se dedica a la elaboración de manteles de forma artesanal desde hace más de 20 años. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un muro de retención y para construir una galera para ubicar el telar y tenerlo más seguro ya que es su principal herramienta de trabajo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, madera y lámina galvanizada para poder proceder a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: María is 60 years old and lives in her own house with her son. For 20 years she has worked making traditional tablecloths. María is asking FUSAI for this loan to use it in the construction of a retaining wall and to build a shed, which will allow her to place her loom in a safe place, since it is her main working tool. With the loan she will buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, wood and galvanized steel sheet to start with the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy: brick, cement, sand, gravel, wood and galvanized steel sheet to buy a retaining wall and a shed.

loans.name: Diadema

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Diadema works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Diadema is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Diadema has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 26-year-old single gentleman who supports his four siblings. He has operated a transport business in Narok County, Kenya, for the last three years with a monthly income of KES 26,000. He learned about VisionFund from a loan officer who was carrying out a marketing campaign in his area of operation.

He has been advanced a first loan of KES 20,000, which he will use to repair his lorry. He gets a lot of business from the quarry and from transporting building materials around the town. He hopes to buy a piece of land in the future. 

William's dream is to see an improved standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to service his lorry

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old, married and together with her spouse, has been blessed with five children. She is a farmer and has been in the farming business for nine years now. She also has a retail business. Right now, her monthly income is KES 40,000. Her spouse also provides additional income.

She will be using the loan to pay school fees for her child who is in high school. This is her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya and she has been paying her previous loans successfully.

In the future, Mary hopes to educate her children up to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Sandro Ernesto

texts.es:
Sandro tiene 26 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato y ahora está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen una hija y el grupo familiar solo está formado por ellos tres.

A Sandro le gusta mucho el trabajo, es por eso que tiene un taller de pintura desde hace 8 años, él se dedica a pintar carros, después que terminó de estudiar bachillerato, vio la situación difícil en el país y no encontraba trabajo, decidió entonces poner su propio negocio en casa, siendo esta la única actividad a la que él se dedica. Esta actividad la aprendió durante un año que estuvo yendo a un taller, aprendió el oficio, y solo busca a alguien que le ayude cuando se le acumulan carros para pintar, sus actividades diarias las hace desde las 7:00 AM hasta las 5:00 PM.

El préstamo que Sandro está solicitando, lo necesita para pagar unas deudas que tiene pendientes en una institución financiera, pues siente que lo están ahogando con los intereses, y con el dinero que gane en el taller espera pagar cada cuota, además invertirá en su negocio comprando más pintura por mayoreo y hacer agradable el lugar de trabajo para tener un mejor clima laboral. 

Él suena con tener en un futuro un taller de pintura muy reconocido ya que lo visitan bastantes clientes, además desea hacerlo más grande, ayudar a otras personas dándoles empleo y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Sandro is 26 years old and completed secondary education. He is married, and his wife takes care of the household. They have a daughter and their family is just the three of them. Sandro likes to work and has had a car-painting workshop for eight years. When he finished his studies, he took a good look at the difficult situation in the country, saw that he could not find a job, and decided to start his own business in his house. This is his only activity. He took one year to learn the trade in a workshop, and now he has his own and only hires help when there are more cars than he can paint on his own. He works from 7 am to 5 pm. He asks for a loan to pay outstanding loans to another financial institution, which he feels practices prohibitive interest rates. He will use his income from the workshop to repay the Kiva loan. He also intends to invest in his business by buying more paint wholesale and improving the workspace in order to have a better workplace environment. He dreams of his workshop becoming well-known in the region, and already has many customers. He also wishes to expand his workshop in order to be able to help other people by giving them a job and to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay outstanding loans.

loans.name: Gracelia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Gracelia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Gracelia is borrowing PHP 9,500 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Gracelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell .

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 59 years old and married.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Angela is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

Angela has been in this business for one year and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock plus feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis is a lady of thirty years, married and a mother of one lovely child. She sells beauty products in Ruaka in the outskirts of Kiambu. She has been in this business for five years and gets a monthly income of 36,000 KES.

This will be Phylis's first loan with Vision fund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more beauty products for her business. In future she wants to own properties and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products like hair weaves and hair oil

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is fifty years old, married and has five children, two of whom are still in school.

Luzminda is in the agricultural business, specifically pig fattening, in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Luzminda has been in pig fattening for two years now. She has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Luzminda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products for her store.

loans.name: Umoja Sungwa Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a mother of two children, a son and a daughter, who are both in school. She is in her early forties and a married woman. For three years now, Elizabeth has had a business selling second-hand clothes and fabrics. Her business is showing a good viability but she does not have enough capital to improve. She operates her business from 10am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy stocks of clothes. Elizabeth managed to pay back her entire loan. She manage to earn an extra income which she used to pay school fees and home food expenses. She also saved a portion. 

Elizabeth will use this loan to buy new stocks of second-hand clothes and fabrics to resell. She dreams that one day she will be able to build a very good family house. Elizabeth will share this loan with her loan group "UMOJA SUNGWA," which has five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new stocks of second-hand clothes and fabrics to resell.

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Milagro tiene 49 años de edad, sus padres no tenían las falicidades económicas para mandarla a la escuela, es por eso que desafortunadamente no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ahora ella está acompañada y tiene un hijo, y nadie mas depende de ella.

La señora ya tiene 5 años de poseer una tienda, la idea de negocio surgió cuando ella se dio cuenta que en su comunidad hacía falta una tienda, su hijo se involucra ayudándole después que regresa de las clases, esto le ha servido de mucho a Milagro, pues le permite cubrir algunos de sus gastos económicos. Ella solo se dedica a esta actividad, su pareja le ayuda mucho cuando ella tiene que salir a la ciudad a comprar la mercancía, por lo tanto todos colaboran para que el negocio funcione bien..

Ella está solicitando este crédito, pues desea comprar productos para surtir la tienda , ya que algunos no los posee y queda mal con los clientes, esto ayudará mucho a su comunidad, ya que los habitantes de esta no tendrán que viajar hasta la ciudad para comprarlos y  a ella le beneficiará mucho porque tendrá mayores ingresos y podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

Milagro tiene un gran sueño en la vida, que su hijo logre preparase académicamente y poder llegar a tener un estatus académico mas alto que el de ella, pues por circunstancias de la vida ella no pudo estudiar pero quiere que su hijo si lo logre.
texts.en:
Milagro, 49, was unable to get an education, unfortunately, because her parents could not afford it.  She has a common-law husband and a son and no other dependents.

For five years she has been running a store.  The idea for the business came to her because she noticed there was no store in her community.  Her son helps in the store when he gets home from school and this has been of much help to Milagro, since she is able to cover some of the household expenses.  This is the only work she has and her husband helps when she has to go to the city to buy merchandise, so everyone collaborates in the business so it runs smoothly.

She is requesting a loan to buy more products to stock the store because when she runs out of something it does not sit well with the customers.  The investment will help the community since the local people will not have to go to other cities for their shopping and she will increase her income and enjoy a better quality of life.

Milagro's greatest dream in life is for her son to receive training and reach a higher educational status than she did.  Due to life's circumstances she was unable to go to school but she wants her son to do so.

loans.use: To buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernedette is a thirty-year-old lady, married and a mother of three children aged fifteen,twelve and seven. She runs a retail shop in Narok town, Kenya. She has been doing this for the last four years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. With a loan of KES 10,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, she plans to restock her retail shop with a variety of consumable products.

The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into business for expansion. Her dream is to be successful in life and improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to restock her retail shop

loans.name: Dany Margarita

texts.es:
Dany es una mujer trabajadora de 31 años de edad, es ama de casa que solo logró estudiar hasta segundo grado en la escuela, ahora ella está acompañada y tiene una pequeña venta de helados en su cantón, tiene dos hijos los cuales uno de ellos esta yendo a la escuela, ella vive con su esposo y  su padre quien está postrado en una cama después de sufrir en parálisis cerebral.

Ella tiene cuatro años de tener una tienda de helados, este trabajo lo aprendió gracias a su padre quien era el encargado del negocio antes de sufrir la parálisis cerebral, a ella le gustó mucho el negocio es por eso que empezó a dedicar  mas tiempo en él, ya que también es la única fuente de ingreso de su familia.

Dany solicita este crédito, ya que necesita invertir en su negocio, pues tiene algunos problemas y con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar su negocio lo cual significa que sus ingresos mejoraran y tendrá una mejor calidad de vida.
 
Ella tiene grandes sueños, uno de ellos es que sus hijos puedan crecer sanos y que puedan ir a la escuela, también que su padre pueda recuperar el movimiento en sus piernas, y además el crédito le servirá de muchi.
texts.en:
Dany, 31, is a hard-working homemaker who only was able to get a second grade education.  Now she has a common-law husband and a small ice cream business in the canton where she lives.  She has two children, one of whom attends school.  She lives with her husband and father who is an invalid with cerebral palsy.

For four years she has been running an ice cream store which she started thanks to her father who managed the business before his illness  She likes the  business a lot and decided to dedicate more time to it because it is the main source of income for the family.

Dany is requesting a loan to invest in her business because she has a few problems and with the loan she will be able to improve her activity.  This will increase her income and give her a much better quality of life.

She has grand dreams of seeing her children grow up healthy and go to school.  She also wants her father to recover the use of his legs.  The loan will be very useful.

loans.use: To invest in her ice cream business.

loans.name: Jaime Otoniel

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 50 años de edad, desafortunadamente no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y la pobreza les impidió mandarlo a la escuela. Él está casado y su esposa se dedica a elaborar tamales de gallina y tamales pisques, tiene 3 hijas que con esfuerzo terminaron de estudiar bachillerato, aparte de su esposa e hijas también su madre vive con él. 

Jaime es panificador en pequeño, este oficio lo aprendió a los 17 años, gracias a que su hermano le consiguió trabajo en una panadería donde él trabajaba. Jaime se encarga de distribuir en la bicicleta, los tamales que hace su espossa, pues ella padece de una enfermedad y la operaron recientemente, su estado le impide salir a vender los tamales. En esta actividad se involucran la hija del señor y su cuñada, y sale a las 5:00 AM en la bicicleta, a vender los por todo el pueblo, por la mañana vende los tamales de gallina, y por la tarde los tamales pisques, a los clientes les gusta mucho pues es un producto de tradición nacional.

Debido a que Jaime también se dedica a la actividad de panificador, él está solicitando este préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio de la panadería, y comprar la materia prima: harina, azucar, manteca, bandejas, etc y comprar una mesa donde pueda tener el producto. De esta forma se le estará ayudando, pues ya posee un horno para poder trabajar en la panaderia, y lo mas importante que ya tiene experiencia en el negocio.

Jaime se ha propuesto muchas metas en la vida, desea ser un panificador en grande, poder comprar un horno con mucha mas capacidad, tambien desea tener una motocicleta para salir a vender el pan, y asi se le haga mas facil hacer el recorrido para la venta, también sueña con remodelar su casa y ampliarla para tener mas comodidad. Todos esto, dice que podra lograrlo con su esfuerzo y con la ayuda de los créditos, y por eso se siente muy agradecido con la institución.
texts.en:
Jaime, 50, was unable to go to school, unfortunately, because his parents could not afford it due to poverty.  He is married and his wife makes chicken and red bean tamales.  They have three daughters who, through hard work, were able to get a high school education.  His mother also lives with the family.

Jaime has a small bakery business.  He learned he trade when he was 17 and his brother got him a job at the bakery where he worked.  Jaime delivers his goods and the tamales his wife makes by bicycle.  His wife is ill and had an operation recently, so she is unable to go out and sell the tamales.  Jaime's daughter and sister-in-law help in the business.  He goes out on his bike at 5:00 a.m. to sell throughout the village.  In the morning he sells chicken tamales and in the afternoons he sells the red bean tamales.  All of his customers love the products because they are a national tradition.
