Since Jaime also has his bakery business he is requesting a loan to buy supplies: flour, sugar, shortening, trays, etc. and a table to display the products.  This will be helpful for him because he already has an oven for the bakery, and most importantly, already has experience in the business.

Jaime has many goals in life.  He wants to be a good baker and buy an oven with much more capacity.  He also wants to buy a motorcycle to sell bread, so it is easier to go out to sell.  Another goal is to renovate his house to make it more comfortable.  He says he can achieve all of this through much effort and the support of the loans, so he is very grateful to the institution.

loans.use: To buy supplies:  flour, sugar, shortenin, trays and tables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
LILIANI, who is in her early 40s is married with four children who are still in school.  She has been selling chips, eggs, chicken and mishikaki since 2000.   She works from 6 AM to mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be LILIANI's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to make more soup with chapati in the morning and chips starting in the evening up to mid-night and has repaid all of her loans successfully.  She is grateful for the loans and appreciates everyone who has supported her group.  She used the profits to pay school fees, bought a plot of land and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy goats and sell some of them live and some to slaughter and sell as meat.  She dreams of building another house.

Lilian will share this loan with her loan group "Tumaini" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell some of them live and some to slaughter and sell as meat.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married lady aged 29 who supports a family of three members.  She is blessed  with one child aged six.  She offers M-Pesa services in Kabarnet and has been in the business for a period of three years, earning an income of KES 20,000.

She is now servicing her second loan of KES 45,000 from vision Fund Kenya and intends to use this amounts to purchase business accessories for her business.  The profits she earns will be used to repay the loan and help the needy in the society.

Her dream is to be successful in both business and in life.

loans.use: To purchase mobile accessories

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha, aged 40 years old, is married and has seven children.  She has been farming rice and growing pineapples for 20 years.  The current business earns her about 34,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Tha’s group consists of two female members.  This is her first cycle with VisionFund.  Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland.  She hopes this loan will enable her to grow more crops so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is a 29 years old man from Kakamega town, within western part of Kenya.  He is married to Hellen who is a business lady and supports the family.   He supports five people in the family and has one child who is three months old.

He operates a motorcycle transport within his local town.  He has been operating this kind of business for the last three years and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES 15,000,  He is taking his first loan VISION FUND KENYA, which he will use to boost his business. 

He will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.  His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to boost his business.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 29-year-old married mother of two children, who has been working in the beauty business for two years.  Souad is specialized in women's facial tattoo designs that has to do with lips, eyebrows and eyeliners.

She is a hard worker, who puts so much effort to develop her business which she currently runs from her house, since she isn't financially capable now to establish a separate beauty salon.  At the same time she is taking good care of her beloved children.  Today, Souad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy an updated newly released tattoo machine specialized for women, which is important in her business development.

She is very anxious about this loan because she believes it will be her first step forward towards developing her business and opening her own future specialized facial tattoo and eyelashes services beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy an updated newly released tattoo machine specialized for women which is important in her business development

loans.name: Julián

texts.es:
ulián es una persona de 68 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura en pequeño, en la siembra de maíz y frijoles.  Él carece de estudios, ya que en la época en la que él se encontraba apto para realizar sus estudios básicos, el acceso a la educación era demasiado complejo ya que existía en su familia la falta de recursos económicos, lo que lo obligo a trabajar la agricultura con su padre. Julián es el hermano mayor de 2 y le correspondía trabajar con su padre para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su hogar, de esta manera fue adquiriendo conocimiento y experiencia en la agricultura y hasta la actualidad se dedica a realizar esta actividad.

Él siembra granos básicos y cuenta con una experiencia de 45 años, la cual la adquirió de su padre que fue con quien él se creció y aun se dedica a realizar dicha actividad, motivado por los buenos resultados en las cosechas y porque de esa misma manera provee a su familia de las necesidades básicas; él realiza estos trabajos con ayuda de su hijo mayor. 

El crédito sera invertido en el mejoramiento de la cerca perimetral que rodea su casa, porque la que la que tiene se encuentra en mal estado y le dificulta el control de los animales domésticos y vuelve su vivienda vulnerable por estar desprotegida.


Los proyectos que  Julián tiene para un futuro son,  con ayuda de otro financiamiento poder hacer una cerca perimetral con tela metálica, de esta forma tendrá una vivienda mas segura y tranquila y mantendrá un mejor control sobre los animales domésticos y apoyar a sus nietos a realizar sus estudios básicos.
texts.en:
Julián is 68 years old and is a small farmer who raises corn and beans.  He lacks a formal education since access to education was too complex as it existed in his time and his family's lack of financial resources forced him to have to go to work with his father.  Julian is the older of two brothers and he had to go to work with his father to satisfy the basic needs of the family.  This is how he acquired knowledge and experience in farming and he still does this.

He raises basic grains and has been doing this for 45 years and learned this from his father.  He continues doing this because of the good results in harvests and because he provides for his family’s basic needs this way.  His oldest son helps him.

He will use the money from this loan to improve the perimeter fence around his house, because the one he has is in bad shape and he has problems controlling his domestic animals and leaves his home unprotected.

Julian’s projects for the future are, with the help of another loan, to build a chain link fence so he can have a more secure and peaceful home and better control over his animals.  He also wants to support his grandchildren in their education.

loans.use: to build a fence.

loans.name: Sixto Rafael

texts.es:
Sixto tiene 54 años de edad, desafortunadamente no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, actualmente está soltero pero tiene un hijo. Vive con sus hermanos y de él.

Desde que Sixto tenía ocho años de edad, empezó a trabajar en la agricultura junto a su padre y hermanos,  realizaban la producción de maíz. 
Hoy en día trabaja como jornalero, además siembra dos hectáreas de maíz y tiene dos novillas, a las cuales cuida y las lleva todos los días para que coman a un terreno donde hay pasto. 
Sixto es una persona con muchos deseos de superarse, es por eso que todos los días, se levanta con muchos ánimos y positivismo para seguir adelante.

El préstamo que él está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para comprar ganado, de esta manera podrá aumentar el número de animales y tendrá la oportunidad de criarlos y seguir con la reproducción y que no falte el dinero para mantener a su familia.

Sixto sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda, también le gustaría aprender a leer y escribir pues él piensa que nunca es tarde para superarse, además le gustaría tener más animales y aumentar para este año el área de siembra.
texts.en:
Sixto is 54 years old. Unfortunately, he did not have the opportunity to get an education. He is currently single, but he  has one son. He lives with his siblings and his son.

Since he was eight years old, Sixto worked in agriculture with his father and brothers in corn production. Today he is a day laborer. He also plants two hectares of corn and has two heifers which he takes care of. He takes them with him every day to find grazing land. Sixto is a person with a strong desire to excel, and that is why he gets up every day with a positive attitude and a lot of enthusiasm about getting ahead.

The loan he is seeking from CrediCampo is to buy cattle so he can increase the number of animals he is raising and continue to breed them so he will have enough money to take care of his family. Sixto dreams of finishing building his house. He would also like to learn to read and write because he thinks it is never too late to improve himself. He would also like to have more animals and increase his planting acreage this year.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio de 30 años de edad, depende de una familia pobre el cual no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar, por lo que no tiene ningún grado educativo, esta a acompañado su esposo trabaja en un pequeño puesto de venta de elote en el mercado municipal, sus dos hijos residen con la abuela quien es la mamá de Mauricio y están estudiando  4º y 1º  grado,  por lo que solo vive con su esposa  dado que sus hijos viven con la abuela.

Mauricio se dedica a la compra y venta de elote desde hace 10 años , lo aprendió de una persona amiga para la que él fue su empleado por 3 años y luego se desidia tener su negocio propio y su esposa le ayudan a las ventas  mientras él se transporta en su motocicleta a buscar  a los cantones mas milpas en elote, esas son las actividades que el realiza para sacar adelante a familia.



El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprara mas milpas en elote para disponer de más elotes para satisfacer a sus clientes  y tener mercadería suficiente ya que hay escasees de milpas en elote, esto le ayudara a tener mas ingresos y mas ganancias en su negocio y poder cancelar su crédito y surtir sus necesidades económicas.


 Mauricio sueña con mejorar su vivienda  y hacer crecer su negocio y darles el estudio a sus dos hijos  y espera de que Dios le de salud para seguir trabajando, para que esto se le haga realidad y gracias a los créditos espera lograr todos sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 30 years old and depends on a poor family and didn’t have the opportunity to go to school so he has no formal education.  He is married and sells corn from a small stall in the local market.  His two children live with their grandmother, Mauricio’s mother, and are in 4th and 1st grade.  He lives only with his wife because the children live with their grandmother.

Mauricio has been buying and selling corn for 10 years and learned this from a friend who employed him for three years.  He later decided to have his own business and his wife helps him with sales while he goes out around the area on his motorcycle looking for more corn fields.  These are the things he does to help the family get ahead.

He is asking for this loan so he can buy fields of corn so that he can satisfy his customers and have enough merchandise on hand since there is a shortage.  This will help him have more income in his business so he can pay off his debt and pay his financial needs.

Mauricio wants to improve his house and grow his business and provide his children with an education.  He asks God for good health so he can continue working so that he can make his goals a reality and is thankful for all the loans that will help him achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 53-years-old and has one child. Josephine is married and her one child is in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Josephine has been in pig fattening for 17 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Neris

texts.es:
Neris tiene 47 años de edad, solamente estudió hasta educación media, está casado y tiene 2 hijos.

Neris se dedica al trabajo en la agricultura junto con su esposa, este oficio lo aprendió gracias a sus padres que se lo enseñaron desde muy pequeño. Para llegar a la parcelas en las que trabaja, Neris debe caminar 2  km,  trabaja durante la mañana, además su esposa cuida las vacas que poseen, Neris posee un vehículo con el que trabaja realizando viajes por las tardes, de modo que se dedica a muchas actividades para que nunca le falten los ingresos para su familia.

Él está solicitando este préstamo a CrediCampo, para comprar dos vacas que necesita para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener mejores ingresos. 

Sus planes a futuro son,  comprar un vehiculo en mejores condiciones para su trabajo de motorista, pues el que tiene actualmente es bastante antiguo y le da problemas.
texts.en:
Neris is 47 years old, and he only went to school until high school. He is married and has two kids. 

Neris works in agriculture together with his wife. He learned this trade thanks to his parents who taught him from a very young age. To arrive at the plots where he works Neris has to walk 2 km, he works during the morning, and also, his wife takes care of the cows that they have. Neris has a car with which he works, carrying out trips in the afternoon. Hhe works in many activities so he never lacks income for his family. He is requesting this loan from CrediCampo in order to buy two cows that he needs to increase production of milk to sell and obtain better profits. 

His plans for the future are to buy a car in better condition for his job as a driver because the one he has now is pretty old and gives him problems.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
Phat, 54, is married and lives with her husband and five children in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She and her husband are rice farmers, and they supplement their family’s income through working for others for a fee. She has been in the rice farming business for sixteen years, earning about 28,000 KHR per day to feed her family. 

Phat has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Phat will use her portion to pay for plowing the rice field.  She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to pay for plowing the rice field

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is a 27-year-old lady from Kakamega county and is married to Willis, who is also businessman in the same town.  They have two children, ages 10 and 7 respectively.
She operates a retail shop, a business she has done for the last 3 years, earning an average income of KES 15,000 per month.  She is taking her 2nd loan of KES 15,000 with VisionFund Kenya to use in buying cartons of sweets, soap, sacks of rice and jerrycans of cooking oil. The profits will be used to repay the loan and do some savings.
Her dream is to prosper and bring up a stable family.

loans.use: To purchase cartons of sweets, sacks of flour, and many other goods to resell to her clients.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 32 years old, married to Nolmeyoki, and the father of three children aged between eight and two years old. For the last ten years, he has farmed his own piece of land and earns a good income. Wheat has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions.  He learned about VisionFund Kenya through a client. 

This will be his sixth loan of KES 60,000. He plans to buy farm inputs and hire machinery for preparation of the land.  With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His future dreams are that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more wheat for commercial purpose, buy his own farm machinery, and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and hire machinery

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has four adult children. He is from Thika and has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES, which he uses to support himself and his grandchildren. 

Patrick requested his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase poultry feeds and one pig for rearing. The additional income will allow him to improve the standard of living for his grandchildren. In the future, Patrick would like expand his farming to become a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds and one pig for rearing

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a business buying and selling native mats in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional native mats to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 15 years now.

Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional native mats to sell

loans.name: Glendy Yitel

texts.es:
Glendy 38 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado de básica, es casada su pareja se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería, han procreado 4 hijos, 3 estudian en la escuela el otro no tiene la edad para ir a la escuela. Ella  tiene una venta en el cafetín de la escuela de su comunidad, ya tiene 10 años de trabajar en el cafetín.
El crédito lo usara para surtir más el cafetín con la compra de bebida, golosinas, pan, pollo, verduras, etc. mas con el objetivo de satisfacer la demanda en la escuela.
texts.en:
Glendy is 38 years old. she went to school up to the ninth grade. She is married and her spouse works in farming and ranching. They have 4 children. Three of them are in school and the other one is too young for school. She has a snack bar at a community school and has been working at that for 10 years.

She will use the loan to stock her snack bar more by buying beverages, snacks, bread, chicken, vegetables, etc. in order to meed the demand at the school.

loans.use: to buy beverages, snacks, bread, chicken, vegetables and more in order to meet the demand at the school.

loans.name: José Juan

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años de edad, es un hombre casado que convive junto a su esposa y sus hijos y solamente estudió hasta educación media.

José se dedica al trabajo de bombero desde hace diez años, donde labora los siete días de la semana, dia y noche, es un trabajo pesado pero él menciona que le llena de satisfacción y a su familia también, el señor se levanta a las 5:00 AM junto a su esposa que lo apoya en la actividades que él realiza. 

Él está solicitando este préstamo, pues necesita comprar los materiales para poder cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que esta muy dañado y se acerca invierno, las fuertes lluvias puede ocasionar que se filtre el agua a su casa, lo cual no es apropiada para la seguridad de su familia.

José planea para un futuro, que con los ingresos que obtiene de su empleo, podrá  construirle a su familia una vivienda digna en la cual no corran ningún peligro.
texts.en:
José, age 37, is married and lives with his wife and children.  He only attended school through middle school.  José has been working as a fireman for ten years.  He works seven days a week, day and night.  It is a hard work, but he says that it fills him with satisfaction, and his family, too.  He gets up at 5:00 a.m. with his wife, who supports him in all of the business activities that he does.

He is requesting this loan because he needs to buy materials to be able to change the roof of his house.  It is very damaged, and winter is coming.  The strong rains are able to cause water to leak into the house.  This is not good for his family’s safety.

José’s plan for the future is to use the income from his job to be able to build his family a decent house, which does not pose any risks.

loans.use: to buy materials to be able to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en: Fuad is a taxi driver. He is 30 years old and single. He is living in Baku region with his parents. His father was sick and his mother is a housewife, so they can’t work on a regular business and all needs of the family are provided by Fuad, who is a taxi driver. A while ago his car was in an accident. Today he needs a loan in the amount of 800 Azerbaijan New Manat- AZN to repair his car. Fuad says that he is sincerely thankful to Kiva  and its lenders for their help. In the future he wants to get married and to have children.

loans.use: to repair his car used as a taxi

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, a 48-year-old single mother of one from Thika, owns a business selling cereals and other grains. She currently lacks the capital needed to purchase items in bulk to restock her store. 

With a loan through VisionFund Kenya, Janet will be able to purchase cereals in bulk when she finds goods at low prices. She will then be able to have a fully stocked store, which will attract more customers, generate sales and create more profit due to a lower cost of goods sold. Additional income created will allow her to reinvest in her business, meet the needs of her family, and educate her child through college. 

In the future, Janet would like to eradicate poverty and uplift the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cereals in bulk

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina, 42 years old, is married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with four children. She is a dairy farmer. She has been in the dairy farming business for eight years and right now her monthly income from her business is KES 70,000. Her husband does provide additional income.

She will be using the loan to pay for school fees for her child. This is Celina's fifth loan with VisionFund Kenya and she has been paying her previous loans off successfully.

Her hope in the future is to become a wholesale supplier and see her children getting the best education.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her child.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 49 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, actualmente está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad, los cuales trabajan, por lo tanto Mercedes solo vive con su pareja.

Ella se dedica al trabajo domésticos, actividad que aprendió de su mamá y además le ayuda a su esposo en el trabajo agrícola.

Mercedes está solicitando este préstamo a CrediCampo, para construir una cocina en au casa, lo que le permitirá tener más espacio y orden en el hogar, y además le permitirá realizar cómodamente los quehaceres del hogar.
 
Ella sueña con seguir mejorando su vivienda, para heredarla en un futuro a sus hijos, y para el crédito le servirá de mucho para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 49 years old, and has a fourth grade education.  She is currently married, and her husband works in agriculture.  They have two children who are adults and work.  Mercedes lives alone with her husband.  She devotes herself to household work, which she learned from her mother, but she also helps her husband with his agricultural work.  

Mercedes is seeking this loan from CrediCampo to build a kitchen in her home, which will allow her to have more space and order in her house.  It will also help her to more comfortably do her housework.  She dreams of continuing to improve her home, so one day she can leave it to her children.  The loan will help her to achieve that.

loans.use: to build a kitchen in her house.

loans.name: Ma. Rizalyn

texts.en:
Ma. Rizalyn is 26 years old and has a live-in partner with one child. 

Ma. Rizalyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Ma. Rizalyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase additional livestock, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Ma. Rizalyn has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Ma. Rizalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maricel is 31 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Maricel has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials like abaca thread for her business.

Maricel has been in this business for six years. In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials like abaca thread for her business

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 60 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for her family. Perlita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, bread, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

Perlita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 44 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell.

Vivian has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns income from fish vending. Vivian aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, and suitcases

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sinat is 46 years old and married. She has three children. To make a living, she has been planting pineapple and oranges for sixteen years. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.
Sinat received her first loan three cycles ago and she completely paid back the loans. The past loans from VisionFund have helped her family significantly improve their living and afford to buy a plot of farmland. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sinat is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on pumping the water into her rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to timely grow her rice so as to better her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 33-year-old married woman with three children aged 11, 6, and 2 years old with two of them attending school.

She owns a retail business in Kyotera town which operates seven days a week and 12 hours a day. She is also a teacher in the primary schools in Rakai from where she gets extra income. She was motivated to start a retail business because she wanted to get more money to support her family.

She hopes to use the loan to boost her retail business and has dreams of having a bigger business and a wider client base. She usually sells her products to fellow businesspeople around Kyotera town and local customers.

She faces the challenge of people who take goods on credit and fail to pay, which has stunted her business. She is described as a hard-working and honest woman in business.

loans.use: to buy retail stock in the form of items for daily household use.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a 36-year-old gentleman, married and a father of four children aged 12, 10, eight and seven years old. He has operated a butcher shop for  the last two years with a monthly income of Kes 11,000. He learnt about Vision Fund from a poster. He has been advanced a second loan of Kes 20,000 after successfully repaying the first one. He intends to use the funds to put up a retail shop to complement the butchery sales.

He will use the increased funds to cater for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow the business to a highly profitable venture.

loans.use: to set up a retail shop

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic, a 44-year-old father of five from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Julia, who helps him in farming. He earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), which he uses to support himself and his family. 

This marks his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. With the loan he has applied for from VisionFund Kenya, he will be able to pay school fees for his children. In the future, Dominic would like expand his farming to become a large-scale farmer. 

He hopes to educate all his children through college.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, a 46-year-old father of five from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer.  He also runs a hardware shop which supplements his income. He is married to Elizabeth, who helps him in running the two businesses. 

He earns a monthly income of KES 40,000 which he uses to support himself and his family. This marks his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. With the loan he has applied for from VisionFund Kenya, he will be able to pay the school fees for his children. In the future, Simon would like expand his farming to become a large scale farmer. 

He hopes to educate all his children through college.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling personal products. Arlene is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace, aged 52 years, is married with three children. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has owned a food stall for two years now that has enabled her to raise income to look after her family and pay school fees for her children. Her personal goal is to improve her family's standards of living despite being challenged by seasonality changes and price fluctuations. Grace needs the loan to buy cassava and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Lukiya

texts.en: Lukiya is a thirty-six-year-old farmer. She is married and has four children. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Lukiya has a cocoa garden and has been practicing farming for five years. She gets cocoa beans for selling from her garden and adds more from buying outside her garden to sell to her customers. However, she is challenged with seasonality and poor conditions for her family and she is determined to improve on their standards of living. Lukiya wants a loan to buy cocoa seeds from her suppliers to sell.

loans.use: To buy cocoa seeds from her suppliers to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 25-year-old single man who is the sole breadwinner for three members of his beloved family. Mohamad adores dealing with birds and raising them. In August 2013, he established his current bird raising and selling business, and he is working hard on developing and expanding it as much as he can. Mohamad has five years of experience in this domain. He used to work as a plumber, but he prefers to deal with birds, and he has his own special language to deal with them, he says.

Today, Mohamad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to develop his newly established business with special bird-raising items, cages, hatchery, warming system, feeders, and watering tools. He hopes to keep on developing his business to make sure that it is good enough to cover his beloved family's needs and requests.

loans.use: To develop his newly established business with special bird-raising items, cages, hatchery, warming system, feeders, and watering tools

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah has a retail shop in Kangundo town and has been in the business for six years now. He is 44 years old and married, and together with his spouse, he has been blessed with four children. He supports five people in his family.

He will be using this loan to pay school fees for his child. 

He will use the anticipated profits from his business to improve his business. This is Josiah's fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and his future hopes are to prosper and expand his business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 36 years old and married with three children.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Rowena has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load (phone credits) retailing.

Rowena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mirna Morelia

texts.es:
Mirna tiene 58 años de edad, solo logró estudiar hasta noveno  grado, lamentablemente su pareja falleció hace unos años, tiene 5 hijos pero solamente 2 que son gemelos viven con ella, ellos están estudiando y son los únicos que dependen de Mirna ya que los otros 3 viven en el exterior. 

Mirna tiene una tienda de productos de cocina, también posee un molino, ella tiene más de diez años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ya que la necesidad de tener un ingreso económico fue la que hizo que Mirna tomara la decisión de iniciar con la tienda, el negocio lo tiene en su casa por lo que atiende desde que se levanta hasta que se acuesta.

Ella necesita de este préstamo, para invertirlo en el negocio, con lo que comprará  más mercancía para ampliarlo, esto le permitirá a Mirna tener mayores ingresos y automáticamente podrá brindarle los estudios a sus gemelos. 

 Ella desea ir creciendo poco a poco con las ventas y la  clientela, tener una mejor estabilidad, se esforzará muchísimo para que el negocio dé resultados y así mismo poder ampliarlo en un futuro.
texts.en:
Mirna is 58 years old, and was only able to reach ninth grade in school.  Sadly, her husband passed away a few years ago.  She has five children, but only two of them, who are twins, live with her.  They are in school, and are the only ones who depend on Mirna since the other three live outside of the country.  Mirna has a store that sells kitchen products, and she also has a mill.  She has over ten years of experience in this field, as the need to earn an income forced Mirna to make the decision to open the store.  She has the store in her home, and she tends to it from the time she wakes up until she goes to sleep.  

She is need of this loan to invest in her business by purchasing more merchandise in order to expand it.  This will allow Mirna to increase her earnings and provide her twins with an education.  She hopes to continue to grow little by little in her sales and customer base, and increase her stability.  She will put a lot of effort into her business so that it will be profitable and she will be able to expand in the future.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 33 years old and married with three children.  With two of her children in school, Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. She sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, sardines, and other groceries. 

Mary Jane requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dominica

texts.en:
Dominica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines. Dominica has been in this business for 17 years now.

Dominica requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell

loans.name: Enma Nelys

texts.es:
Emma de 55 años de edad, realizo sus estudios hasta 6 grado,  actualmente está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ella tiene a su cargo a dos hijos de 19 y 22 de edad  de los cuales una de sus hija tiene una niña de 2 años de edad de los cuales ninguno de sus hijos están estudiando y uno de ellos trabaja en los estados unidos,  la señora se encuentra trabajando en la ciudad en donde realiza los oficios domésticos tiene 6 meses de estar trabajando donde obtiene los ingresos para los gastos del hogar , además la señora tiene el apoyo de su hijo quien le manda remesa para solventar los gasto en el hogar.

La señora utilizara el préstamo, para pagar la mano de obra para recolectar la cosecha del cultivo de maíz, tiene sembrada 12 tareas de cultivo de maíz y teniendo el dinero se dispondrá a realizar la recolección  para obtener mayor rendimiento de cosecha y la cliente dispondrá de los granos básicos para la alimentación de su familia.

Sus sueños son obtener un buen rendimiento de la cosecha ya que es muy importante para ella para la alimentación de su familia y apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan tener sus cosas y que su nieta pueda estudiar a futuro.
texts.en:
Emma is 55 years old. She went to school up to the 6th grade. Now she is married and her husband is a farmer. She has two children, aged 19 and 22. One of her children has a 2 year old child. Neither of her children is in school, and one is working in the United States. Emma is working in the city, where she does housework. She has been working for 6 months and earns income for her household expenses. In addition, she has help from her son who sends her money to help with the household expenses.  

She will use the loan to pay for labor costs to harvest the corn crop. She has 1.8 acres of corn and with the money she can do the harvest to have a better yield and have basic grains to feed her family. 

Her dream is to have a good yield on the harvest, because it is very important for her to feed her family and support her children so that they can have their things and her granddaughter can go to school in the future.

loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest the corn crop. She has 1.8 acres of corn.

loans.name: Soern

texts.en:
Soern is 55 years old and married with four children. She and her husband live in a village of the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, Soern and her husband have been farming tobacco for 35 years, earning about 29,000 KHR per day.

Soern is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. Soern hopes to grow her crops better and produce higher yields in order to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sokngi's Group

texts.en:
Sokngi, 35, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Koh Sotin district, Cambodia. Of all of her four children, she has two that are still in school. To feed the family, Sokngi and her husband earn a living as farmers who have been growing tobacco and raising pigs for 15 years, earning about 36,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to spend for the family’s needs.

Sokngi has just begun with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sokngi will use her portion to buy fertilizers and gasoline for pumping water. She hopes this loan will enable her to fatten her pigs and grow more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and gasoline for pumping water

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase corn and wood to make tortillas, and finish paying for the deeds of some land that she had acquired.

loans.name: Eddelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Eddelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business of selling ornamental plants in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Eddelyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more ornamental plants to sell.

Eddelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ornamental plants to sell.

loans.name: Zakaliya

texts.en: Zakaliya is a thirty-seven-year-old man. He is married with four children and five dependents. He lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. Zakaliya deals in the motorcycle transport and cocoa businesses through selling to his customers. He also sells cocoa from his garden. He has been operating these businesses for fourteen years in Bundibugyo town council. He wishes to develop his home and family. However, he is challenged with the off season and not getting high profits. Zakaliya has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Emelia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Emelia dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Yllogen Adalberto

texts.es:
Yllogen de 43 años de edad,  quien estudio hasta el séptimo grado de educación básica, casado vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos los cuales la hembra mayor trabaja en una distribuidora de ropa en la zona, el varón trabaja junto a él en tramitaciones aduanales y la menor está estudiando séptimo grado de educación básica; su esposa vende tortillas, negocio que tiene en su vivienda 

El cliente además de dedicarse al cultivo de granos básicos, trabaja en tramitaciones aduanales negocio en el cual ya tiene 6 años de dedicarse junto a su hijo, que desde hace dos años le está enseñando el negocio; Yllogen decidió dedicarse a este negocio ya que es uno de los negocios más fuertes en la zona, además del cultivo de granos básicos. 	

EL préstamo que está solicitando, es para la compra de un molino de nixtamal que le está vendiendo un vecino, con la compra del molino considera que tendrá otra fuente de ingreso familiar, y el cual administrara su esposa.  

A futuro planea ya con el molino en su casa generándole ingresos, descansar un poco más y dedicarle más tiempo a la familia, en cuanto a su hijo menor quien está estudiando básica, quiere que logre culminar sus estudios universitarios para ser una persona de profesional.
texts.en:
Yllogen is 43 years old. He went to school through the seventh grade. He is married and he and his wife have three children. The oldest, a daughter, has a clothing distribution business in the area. Their son works with him in customs processing, and the youngest is in seventh grade. His wife sells tortillas, a business she has at home.

In addition to growing basic grains, he works in customs processing. He has been doing this for 6 years with his son, whom he has been teaching about the business for two years. Yllogen decided to work in this business because it is one of the strongest ones in the area, in addition to growing basic grains.   	

The loan he is asking for is to buy a corn grinder that a neighbor is selling him. With the purchase of the grinder, he will have another source of family income, which his wife will manage. 

In the future, he plans on the grinder generating income for his home, resting a little more and spending more time with his family. Since his youngest child is in school, he wants her to finish college and have a profession.

loans.use: to buy a corn grinder.

loans.name: José Sifredo

texts.es:
José de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato es casado su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos,  tiene 2 hijos de dos y 4 años que aun no estudian, el cliente tiene dos años de trabajar en la institución. Él  es motorista, también trabaja la agricultura en la siembra de maíz; él se transporta hacia su trabajo aproximadamente 30 minutos.
José esta construyendo una habitación más en su casa,  el cual ya levanto las paredes falta el techo, puertas y piso y para eso necesita el préstamo.
El cliente desea arreglar su casa, que su familia viva en lo propio y poder darle el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old, and has a high school education.  He his married, and his wife devotes herself to household work.  They have two children, ages 2 and 4, who are still not in school.  José has been working in the institute for two years.  He is a driver, but also works in agriculture planting corn.  He travels about 30 minutes to get to work.  

José is building an additional room in his home.  He has already put up the walls, but the roof, doors and floor are still left, which is why he is need of this loan.  The client wishes to fix his home so that his family can live in it, and to be able to provide his children with an education.

loans.use: to build a roof, place doors and lay floor in his house.

loans.name: Dolores De La Cruz

texts.es:
Dolores de 24 años de edad, es una madre soltera de un hijo de dos años y medio. Ella estudio hasta bachillerato, el papá del niño es un agricultor, trabajador de una empresa agrícola su trabajo es manejar un tractor;  por lo que le ha obligado según ley una cuota mensual en la actualidad Dolores vive con sus padres.


El trabajo de Dolores, consiste en prestar sus servicios de oficios domésticos, ya que tiene que obtener ingresos por los gastos permanentes que existen, ella lava ropa todos los días,  este trabajo lo hace dentro de la comunidad,  ya tiene los clientes vale mencionar que debido a su buen trabajo a ella no le falta el trabajo;  inicia bien temprano a las cinco de la mañana y termina 10 de la mañana.


El dinero Dolores lo invertirá en el techado de su casa, ya que con el primer crédito levanto las paredes esto hace un año, es así que quiere techarlo y así poder hacer  uso de su vivienda  este sería el segundo crédito.
	
Dolores su gran sueño es concluir su casa ya que siempre fue su sueño, después sería sacar adelante su hijo pero si algo tiene claro que si no es con el Crédito, ella no puede ser realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
Dolores is 24 years old. She is a single mother of a two and a half year old son. She went to high school. The child's father is a farmer and works in an agricultural business driving a tractor. He is legally obligated to make monthly payments. Right now, Dolores lives with her parents.  

Dolores's job is doing domestic work to earn income to pay for the permanent expenses that she has. She washes clothes every day in her community. She has customers and because of the good job that she does she doesn't lack work. She starts very early, at five in the morning, and finishes at 10 in the morning.  

Dolores will invest the loan in a roof for her house. With the first loan, she put up the walls a year ago. She wants to put on the roof so she can use the house. This would be her second loan. 
	
Dolores' big dream is to finish her house. That has always been her dream. After that, it is getting her son ahead. She is very clear: if it weren't for this loan, she couldn't make her dream come true.

loans.use: to put a roof on his house.

loans.name: Douglas Orlando

texts.es:
Douglas es un joven de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, esta acompañado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, no tienen hijos. Douglas es empleado en un supermercado ya tiene dos años de trabajar en esa institución, su trabajo queda aproximadamente a 15 minutos. El crédito lo destinará el mejoramiento  de su casa, arreglar el piso del baño, repellar las paredes y otros pequeños arreglos que le hacen falta.

Sus planes son trabajar y estudiar en las tiempos libres una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Douglas is 25 years old, and has a high school education.  He is married, and his wife devotes herself to household work.  They do not have any children.  Douglas works in a supermarket, and he has worked there for two years.  His job is about 15 minutes away from his home.

The loan will be used to make repairs on his home such as: fixing the floor of the bathroom, plastering the walls and making other small repairs.  His plans are to work and take college courses when he has the free time.

loans.use: to fix the floor of his bathroom, plaster the walls, and make other small repairs.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Dorotea works hard to support her family.

She has a nipa-making business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Dorotea is borrowing PHP 6,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy materials needed for her nipa-making business.

Dorotea has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nipa-making business.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emelita works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from raising pigs. Emelita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business, like pork skins, salt, and cooking oil.

Emelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her business, like pork skins, salt, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en: Husein is a 26-year-old single man who has worked in security for four and a half years. His has requested a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to maintain his motorcycle and pay for a license that will make his transportation to and from work easier and allow him to work as a private driver to earn additional income. Husein is well known in his region and has a good reputation for the special services he provides. He hopes that one day he will be able to establish his own business as a way to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and pay for a license.

loans.name: Yi's Group

texts.en: Yi, who is 22 years old, is married and has one child. She lives with her husband in a rural village in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker and also buys fabrics from a factory to earn additional income by making various items. Her current business activities earn her about 30,000 KHR per day. Yi has been with VisionFund for one previous loan, which she has fully repaid, after using it to better support her family. Now she is leading a group which is requesting a new loan. As the group's leader, Yi is going to buy more fabric to support her business. She hopes this loan will allow her to earn more income from her current activities.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her business

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 75 years old and married with six children.

Clarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like clothing, school supplies and other goods to sell.

She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from her coffee shop.

Clarita aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like clothing, school supplies and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr: jean est une homme de 41 ans, célibataire et père de 2 enfants. il possède et gère un débit de boissons dans un quartier de la ville depuis 3 ans où il vend des boissons hygiéniques.il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des produits hygiéniques pour une valeur de 300 000 f afin d’accroître son stock et satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante, et d'augmenter ses bénéfices. les profits générés vont être réinjectés dans son capital et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, santé, nutrition)
texts.en:
Jean Claude, age 41, is a single father to two children. He runs a bar that he opened three years ago in a local district, and where he sells soft drinks. 

He is seeking this loan to bolster his stock. He plans to buy 300,000 F worth of soft drinks to satisfy his expanding customer base and to increase his profits, part of which will be reinvested in his business while the remainder will be used to provide for his family’s needs (tuition, healthcare, food).

loans.use: to stock up on soft drinks.

loans.name: Delaila

texts.en:
Delaila is a 36-year-old, married mother of four children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from ice-retailing. Delaila is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Delaila has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize, beans, rice and other cereals

loans.name: Roselia

texts.en:
Roselia, aged 36, is married and blessed with three children. She's been in the hog-raising business for almost five years, earning a net income of PHP 5,000 per hog. Her net profits on this business are usually spent on the school allowances of their children. 

Roselia would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase hog feed and piglets to raise. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve more her business to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, por el momento esta acompañado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y la atención de una pequeña tienda en su casa, viven los dos hijos que tienen y uno más que es sobrino.

Miguel es una persona agricultora desde hace 20 años, aprendió a cultivar por su propia cuenta fue producto del conflicto armado es un desmovilizado y tuvo que integrarse a la vida productiva, el trabajo le queda a un kilómetro de la casa, por lo que viaja en bicicleta todos los días ya sea que trabaje en lo propio o ganando para buscar el sostén de sus hijos, son seis horas de trabajo las que realiza al día. 

Miguel invertirá el dinero en la compra de más mercadería, como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, golosinas, bebidas, etc. para la tienda que comenzó hace dos años.  Por lo que necesita insertarle más recursos para que los clientes encuentren lo que necesiten, es así que se sentirán satisfechos.  

Miguel es una persona perseverante, su sueño más grande es tener los recursos necesarios para que cuando sus hijos necesitan poderles dar un apoyo que puedan estudiar una carrera, ya que ellos lo expresan que requieren de ir ahorrando y así poder lograr el objetivo.
texts.en:
Miguel is 40 years old and married. He studied up to Grade 8. His wife works as a housewife and takes care of a small store in their house. They live with their two children and also a nephew that lives with them. 

Miguel has been a farmer for 20 years, something he learned on his own as he was demobilized from the civil war and had to integrate into a productive life. His work is located one kilometer from his house and he gets there by bicycle every day whether he works the fields or with his livestock striving to support his family. He works 6 hours a day. 

Miguel will invest the money from the loan in buying more merchandise like  rice, beans, sugar, oil, detergents, sweets, drinks, etc. for his store which he started two years ago. It is necessary to invest more resources so that the customers find what they need and and leave satisfied. 

Miguel is a determined person. His biggest dream is to have the necessary resources so when his children need it he can give them the support they need to study . So they have to continue saving so they can obtain this objective.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, detergents, sweets, drinks, etc. for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint, sheets, planks of wood, sanders and sandpaper.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en: Juvelyn has been selling fish for four years and earns a good income. She has also successfully repaid a previous loan with her earnings. She used this previous loan to buy fishing supplies. Aside from selling fish, she also prepares snacks for sale in her village. Recently, she requested a new loan to buy ingredients to prepare more snacks to sell. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her living standards and her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks to sell.

loans.name: Maylyn

texts.en:
Maylyn, age 37, is married to a tricycle driver and blessed with three children. She has been selling dried and smoked fish for almost five years, earning a net income of PHP 1,000 monthly. Her net profits are usually spent on school allowances of their children and on daily expenditures. 

Due to insufficient funds, Maylyn would like to avail herself of a loan, amounting to PHP 10,000, to purchase dried and smoked fish to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase dried and smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en: Elenita is 62 years old, married and the mother of three children. She works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Elenita has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. In the future, her goal is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 35, married and the mother of nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur, and has four children who are currently in school. She earns a living by running an abacca-weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional supplies for her business. Arlene has been in this line of work for seven years, and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is 55 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Brgy. Tugas, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Melania has a business selling snacks. She earns about 10,000 PHP each month. 

Melania requested a loan from PMPC for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for snacks. In the future, Melania would like to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for snacks

loans.name: Candelaria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Candelaria tiene 40 años de edad, solamente logró estudiar hasta séptimo grado, actualmente está casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de carpintería, tienen 3 hijos de 22, 20 y 10 años de edad, de los cuales solo uno se encuentra estudiando.

Candelaria es una persona emprendedora con muchos deseos de superación, inició a trabajar a la edad de 15 años vendiendo verduras en el mercado, mas tarde empezó a trabajar como ama de casa, en este último le correspondía realizar los oficios del hogar y otras actividades, ahora continúa trabajando y cuida a dos niños, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 AM y regresa a su casa a las 4:00 PM para atender a su familia. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para la compra de ganado, con la cual camdelaria tendrá otra fuente de ingresos y así mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.

Con el otorgamiento del crédito se le está ayudando a Candelaria a que cumpla uno de sus sueños, el cual es tener ganado, además le gustaría continuar con sus estudios y aprender cosmetologia .
texts.en:
Candelaria, 40, studied only until seventh grade. Now she is married and her husband works in carpentry. They have 3 children ages 22, 20 and 10; only one is studying.

Candelaria is an enterprising person with a strong drive to get ahead. She began working at 15 years old selling vegetables in the market. Later she began working as a housekeeper and in the latter she was required to do household chores and other activities. Now she continues working and takes care of two children. Her work hours are from 7am until 4pm when she returns home to attend to her family. 

The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is needed to purchase livestock, so that Candelaria will have another source of income and improve her family’s quality of life.

Granting this loan helps Candelaria fulfil one her dreams which is to have livestock. In addition, she would like to continue with her studies and learn cosmetology.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Juan tiene 40 años de edad, solamente estudió hasta sexto grado, actualmente está casado y tiene 4 hijos que se encuentan estudiando y dependen de él. 

Juan comenzó a trabajar a la edad de 10 años, limpiaba  algodoneras, además  trabajó en los cañales y seguidamente aprendió el trabajo de albañileria, esta última actividad es la que desempeña hoy en día, además le ayuda a su esposa con la venta de ropa de modo que le gusta tener muchas fuentes de ingresos para mantener el hogar. 

El préstamo que Juan está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita muchísimo para invertir en el negocio de ropa, el cual le permitirá tener crecer en el negocio y así mejorará los ingresos económicos para su familia.

El sueño de Juan, es tener un camión para realizar viajes a las personas que necesiten de ese servicio, crecer en el negocio de venta de ropa y que sus hijos estudien y se preparen para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Juan, 40, studied only until sixth grade. Now he is married and has 4 children who are studying and who are dependent on him. Juan began working at 10 years old, cleaning cotton; he also worked in the cane fields and next learned a bricklayer’s trade. This last activity is what he does nowadays. In addition, he helps his wife with the sale of fashionable clothing as he likes to have many sources of income to maintain the home. 

The loan Juan is requesting from CrediCampo he really needs so he can invest in the clothing business, which will allow him to grow in business and thus improve his income for his family.

Juan’s dreams are to have a truck to travel for people who need this service, to grow his clothing business and that his children study and prepare them to be good people.

loans.use: to invest in the clothing business.

loans.name: Adolfo Ámerico

texts.es:
Adolfo de 34 años de edad, es un agricultor, estudio hasta 6° grado de educación básica, su compañera de vida se dedica a la atención de una pequeña tienda, la hija todavía no asiste a la escuela, con él también vive la mamá que por ende depende de él.


Además, de ña agricultura trabaja la albañilería es otro ingreso adicional, que tiene trabajo que fue aprendiendo de andar de ayudante de otros y hoy él ya realiza trabajos solo, antes era solo la agricultura, casi siempre los trabajos los hace dentro de la comunidad no sale afuera, la tienda en su totalidad la atiende su compañera de vida y su mamá por qué no la tiene en la casa, es a la orilla de la calle.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar seis metros de arena, 20 bolsas de cemento y el pondrá la mano de obra calificada, para mejorar su vivienda.  

En cuanto al sueño de Adolfo, dice que es formar una familia responsable con visión de progresar tener solo dos hijos para poder darles el estudio que él no pudo tener, debido a que eran bastantes hermanos y en cuanto al negocio en el futuro es tener una tienda donde tenga todo lo necesario que los clientes buscan, hacer las compras por mayor para obtener mejores precios y así favorecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Adolfo, 34, is a farmer. He attended primary school until the 6th grade. His partner runs a little shop and his daughter doesn't go to school yet. His mother also lives with him and is therefore dependent on him.

As well as being a farmer, Adolfo works as a bricklayer for extra income. He started out by helping other people and learning as he went, is now able to carry out jobs by himself. Almost all the jobs he does are within his town - he doesn't go further afield. The shop that his partner and mother run is located at the side of the road.

Adolfo is asking for a loan so that he can buy 6 metres of sand and 20 bags of cement, and hire a qualified labourer to make some improvements to his home. He says that his dream is to raise a responsible family. He plans to have just two children so that he can give them the education that he couldn't have as he had too many siblings. For his business, he would like to have a shop where he could stock everything his clients need, and be able to buy wholesale products so that he can offer better prices.

loans.use: to buy 6 metres of sand and 20 bags of cement, and hire a qualified labourer to carry out some home improvements.

loans.name: Héctor Manuel

texts.es:
Héctor es un joven de 24 años de edad,  que estudio hasta 6° grado de educación básica. Por el momento esta soltero no tiene ningún hijo y  vive con una tía y dependen de él tres personas, su tía y dos personas más quienes cuando pequeño dieron la vida por él y ahora es el que responderá así lo manifestó en agradecimiento.  


Héctor se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 8 años cuando por necesidad tuvo que ir a trabajar y es así que le gusto el trabajo, algo que le enseño otro tío a quien le agrádese y hoy también es ayudante de albañil y su misión es aprender.  Los trabajos agrícolas los hace cerca de su casa a cuatro cuadras y le dedica un tiempo de cuatro horas por día. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar materiales y construcción una casa, ya que toda la vida a vivido con sus familiares, su entusiasmo es porque ya esta fabricando el adobe y la madera y le pondrá lamina y hasta ahí estará satisfaciendo la necesidad construir su casa.   

En el futuro el sueño de Héctor  es tener su casa y seguir trabajando para que cada día obtener mejores condiciones más privacidad,  ya como un sueño es tener su familia y primero construir la casa, quiere ser una familia feliz.
texts.en:
Héctor is 24 years old and studied up to Grade 6. At this time he is single and lives with an an aunt. Three people are dependent on him, his aunt and two other people who dedicated their lives for him and now he is returning the favor and showing his gratitude. 

Héctor has been farming for 8 years now since he had to go to work. He likes this work. An uncle taught him to farm and today Héctor is also an assistant bricklayer and his mission is to learn. He does his farming 4 blocks from his house. He spends four hours a day farming. 

The loan that he is requesting is to buy materials to build a house as he has lived with other family members all his life. He is enthusiastic as he is now building with bricks and wood and will put on laminate until he has satisfied his need to build a house. His dream for the future is to have his house and continue to work every day to have better living conditions and privacy as he dreams of having his own family. First he needs to build his house as he wants to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy the materials and build a house.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 35 years old, married, with two children. Both children are in school. Divina is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Divina has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Divina has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es:
Blanca, estudio hasta 2° grado debido a problemas de lejanía del  centro de estudio y a problemas económicos no pudo terminar sus estudios.  Ella está casada y con su esposo ha procreado un hijo de 21 años de edad que estudio hasta bachillerato general;  pero actualmente se dedica a los trabajos del hogar junto a su padre. 

Ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 10 años  y con la cual ha podido salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar ayudándole a su esposo para sacar a su familia adelante,  como el negocio está en su casa ella tiene tiempo para  atender a su familia y el negocio.  Ella aprendió a desempeñar este trabajo debido a que tenía que salir adelante con los gastos del hogar y los ingresos de su esposo eran muy pocos de esta manera ella decidió buscar la forma de obtener un ingreso de dinero extra para aportar en su hogar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para construir una casa de adobe para su hijo,  ya que él desea independizarse de la familia y por eso ella le dará un poco de ayuda con el crédito,  para que él pueda realizar su sueño de tener una casa propia, tanto la vida de la cliente como la de su hijo cambiaran grandemente ya que ella tendrá la satisfacción que le ayude a construir su sueño, de esta manera con el crédito él podrá comenzar la construcción de su casa antes que el invierno llegue y no tengan problemas que se moje.

En el futuro la cliente desea ver cumplido el sueño de su hijo de tener una casa propia,  así como también su satisfacción de verlo cumplido, ella desea que sus ingresos de la tienda sigan creciendo para hacerla más amplia y tratar de llevar todos los productos que sus clientes desean adquirir, lo logrará esforzándose todos los días para trabajar muy duro y así tener el dinero suficiente para surtir y por medio de los créditos.
texts.en:
Blanca studied until second grade. Due to the school being far and for economic problems she wasn’t able to finish her studies.  She is married. She and her husband have a 21-year-old son who studied until high school but now works on household tasks with his father. 

She has had a small shop for 10 years which has allowed her with household expenses helping her husband to get their family ahead. As the business is in her house she has time to attend to her family and the business.  She learned to do this work as she had to come out ahead with household expenses. Her husband’s income was very little and so she decided to look for a way to obtain extra income to contribute to her home.

The loan she is requesting is to build a house of adobe for her son as he wants to become independent. She will provide a little bit of help with the loan so that he can fulfil his dream of having his own house. The client’s life as well as her son’s would extremely change as she would have the satisfaction that she helped him build his dream. With the loan, he could start building his house before winter arrives and not have any problems of it getting wet.
,
In the future the client wishes to see her son’s dream of having his own house fulfilled as well as her satisfaction of seeing it completed. She wants her income from the shop to continue to grow, to expand the shop and to try to bring all the products that her clients want to buy. She will achieve it by striving each day to work hard and therefore having enough money for supplies through the loan.

loans.use: to build a house of adobe for her son.

loans.name: José Atilio

texts.es:
José de 51 años de edad,  esta casado y tiene una linda familia, por la cual se esfuerza todos los días trabajando duro; para llevar el sustento a los suyos; le ayuda su esposa que se encarga de realizar los quehaceres del hogar y lleva también a sus hijos a la escuela, sabedora que si estudian tendrán un futuro mejor.

Él  trabaja en la albañilería y en la agricultura, gracias a estas actividades ha podido construir una vivienda digna y mantener a sus hijos estudiando. En la época lluviosa (mayo- noviembre) cultiva frijol y maíz y en el resto del año se dedica a la construcción. Se le presentan trabajos entre otros lugares teniendo que movilizarse largas distancias, para obtener ingresos. En el trabajo le ayuda el hijo mayor.

Necesita el préstamo para comenzar a preparar la tierra (condiciones para cultivar), pagando trabajadores para cercar el terreno, chapoda de maleza.

En este momento no tiene el dinero para comenzar estos trabajos, ya que no han surgido oportunidades en la albañilería, por lo cual a decidido realizar el crédito, que poco a poco ira cancelando con su trabajo como albañil.

Sueña con que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios, convirtiéndose en unos profesionales y personas de bien; que se valgan por si mismos de una manera honrada. Para que ellos (sus hijos) puedan seguir y terminar sus estudios, sabe que tiene que trabajar arduamente para que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
José, 51, is married with a beautiful family, who he works hard every day to support. His wife helps him by carrying out the household chores and taking the children to school, as they know that if they have an education they will have a better future.

José works as a bricklayer and a farmer, thanks to which he has been able to build a decent home and keep his children in school. During the rainy season (May to November) he grows beans and corn and for the rest of the year he works in construction. Jobs come up in other locations so sometimes he has to travel large distances to earn money. His oldest son helps him with his work.

José needs a loan to begin preparing his land for cultivation, paying workers to put up a fence and removing weeds. At the moment he doesn't have the money to carry out these tasks as he has not had many bricklaying jobs, so he decided to get a loan which he will pay back little by little with his construction work.

His dream is that his children will be able to finish their studies and become respectable people with good jobs - that they are able to feel proud of themselves. He knows that for this to happen he needs to work hard so that they want for nothing.

loans.use: to begin preparing his land for cultivation, paying workers to put up a fence and removing weeds.

loans.name: La Segesse De Bord De Mere Group

texts.fr:
Meniau est le coordinateur de son groupe SEGESSE DE BORD-DE-MERE. Il habite dans la région de Segesse de Bord de Mere, d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Il a dirigé son commerce de Moto pendant 12 années, C'est son 5th prêt avec Esperanza. Avant de commencer ce commerce, il était un professeur. 

Meniau voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans pièces de moto et à acheter produits divers. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces. Meniau dit que ses défis principal est devenie une grande commerçant. Meniau dit que son but principal et son rêve est possède une gros business avec sa propre fond avec la mercy de Dieu.
texts.en:
Meniau is the coordinator of the group SEGESSE DE BORD-DE-MERE. He lives in Segesse de Bord de Mere, a region of Haïti where electricity is scarce and water supplies are very limited. A former teacher, he now owns a motorcycle shop that he has been running for 12 years. This is his 5th loan cycle with Esperanza.  

Meniau wants to use this loan to invest in spare parts and various merchandise. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. 

His primary focus is to become a leading merchant. His main goal and dream is to own a large business acquired with his own capital, and with God’s mercy. 

Other members of the group also need financial assistance for their business activities.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and various merchandise for his motorcycle shop.

loans.name: Adou

texts.fr:
ADOU est né en Décembre 1962 à MENA cercle de KOLONDIEBA; une des  préfectures  de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali. Mr ADOU est âgé de 52 ans ; il réside à FAKOLA  dans le quartier KOKO, dans une famille traditionnelle avec  ses 2 femmes et ses 6 enfants.
